Monsieur A. Koudjo Mazamasso est né en 1970 à Bago, Localité située à 220Km au de Lomé. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Depuis 2003 il a ouvert un centre informatique à Agoè où il faisait le traitement de texte, les photocopies et la vente des produits congelés.
Avec cette petite activité, il arrive à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit qui lui a permis d’acquérir le congélateur, il sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter 3 cartons de produits congelés et deux boîtes de cartouche d’encre.
texts.en:
Mr. Koudjo Mazamasso A. was born in 1970 in Bago, which is located 220 km from Lomé. He is married and the father of one child. In 2003 he opened a computer center in Agoè where he does printing, makes photocopies, and sells frozen foods.

With this business, he manages to support his family.

After a prompt repayment of his first loan, which allowed him to buy a freezer, he is now requesting a second loan to purchase 3 cartons of frozen foods and two boxes of ink cartridges.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 3 cartons of frozen foods and 2 boxes of ink cartridges

loans.name: Donilia

texts.es: Doña Donilia tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Bertha Díaz de la ciudad de Managua, es madre soltera de un niño de 12 años de edad, quién se encuentra cursando la educación primaria. Doña Donilia es comerciante, se dedica a la actividad de  transporte y tiene diez años de estar en este negocio, tiene buses de transporte urbano. Actualmente desea invertir en su actividad, necesita darle mantenimiento a la unidades de buses para que éstos no le presenten problemas y puedan seguir brindando un buen servicio. Espera en un futuro poder adquirir una nueva unidad de bus, para así ir creciendo en su negocio y asegurarle un buen patrimonio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ms. Donilia is 50 years old and lives in the Bertha Díaz neighborhood in the city of Managua. She is a single mother of a 12-year-old boy, who is currently attending elementary school. Ms. Donilia is an entrepreneur who is in the business of public transportation (buses). She has been in business for 10 years. She currently needs to invest in her business by giving maintenance to her buses so that they will not have any problems and that they can keep providing good service. She hopes to obtain another bus in the future, so that her business can keep growing and that she can assure a good patrimony to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bus maintenance

loans.name: Vicky Kombe’S Group

texts.en:
Vicky is a leader of a 4-member group.  She is a 40-year-old single mother of six children between 12 and 22 years old. All of her children go to school. Vicky takes care of two additional family members. She resides in and rents a two -room house where she lives with nine people.  They have electricity, but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. 

Vicky works in a semiurban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport.  She sells Bitenge (African wear) from DR Congo and at times brings jewelry.   Vicky sells to an average of 20 customers a day and works seven days a week. 

Vicky sells on retail and wholesale. Vicky has been in this business for more than 10 years, working seven days a week.  She has been with MCDT for eight years working all this time with the same group members. For her 20th loan,  Vicky wants to use this loan to buy more bitenge and necklaces. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land .

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Ratna Shova

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratna Shova B. lives in a single-family home with her husband, two daughters, and one son in Tangal, Lalitpur district, Nepal. Her older daughter works in a private office and her younger daughter is studying in grade12. Her son left school and now makes religious statues.

Tangal includes one of the very busy bazaars of Lalitpur district. Mrs. Maharjan and her husband, Mr. Gyan Bhakta, opened their tailoring shop 10 years ago. They make different types of custom-fitted lady's dresses, including the kurta-salwar, blouses, and trousers. Tailoring is the traditional work of their family and they were trained by their fathers. Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of NPR 25000.00 loan to buy cloth, cutting tools, and other requirements for her tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru:
Женщина с большим опытом предпринимательской деятельности Зухра  родилась 1957 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Зухра 10 лет занимается продажей женскими различными платками и  шарфами. А также в ее ассортименте большой выбор банных и кухонных полотенец, разновидность постельного белья и подушек. Местом ее деятельности является оптовый рынок "Корвон". Закупает она товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» 
Зухра хочет получить займ 3000 сомони на 9 месяцев, чтоб закупить сезонный товар.
texts.en:
Zuhra is a woman with an extensive experience in entrepreneurship. She was born in 1957, she is married and has four children. Zuhra has been selling different kinds of women's shawls and scarves for ten years. Also, in her inventory there are bathroom and kitchen towels as well as a variety of bed linens and pillows. Her place of business is on the wholesale market Korvon. She buys the merchandise on the same wholesale market Korvon. Zuhra wants to get a loan for 3000 somoni (USD$875) for a 9 months term to buy seasonal merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy towels and bed linens

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 36 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. He has been working as a furniture painter for fifteen years. Mhamad has requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase painting tools. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.
His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. 
Mhamad decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Mhamad will use the loan to purchase painting tools.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is married and has six children. Two of Akua's children are in junior high school. She lives with her family at Wasa Simpa, a suburb of Tarkwa in the western region of Ghana. She is 50 years old. Her husband is a farmer who harvests maize. For the past 4 years, Akua has run a shop where she sells items like women's rubber slippers and bags of rice. Through Akua's unique customer care and bookkeeping management she has attracted many customers who buy from her stand. Sometimes she sells her items door to door ("hawking"). 

Akua belongs to a village bank called "Joy." Akua is constrained by funds for running her business. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. The loan will help her upgrade her inventory by purchasing good quality and in more quantity. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She will be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase rubber slippers and bags of rice.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia baji is a wife of M. A. and they live in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. They have been in this city for the last 10 years. Razia baji’s husband has been a butcher by profession for the past 6 years. Customers are attracted to his shop due to his good behavior and good measurement of meat. Razia baji is applying for a loan to buy animals (goats) for her husband’s butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy goats for butcher shop

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor J. lives with her husband and one of her two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her youngest son is a high school student, and her oldest son is married and lives with his own family. Dolgor is a trained seamstress. For the past few years, she has been sewing various parts of gers, a traditional Mongolian yurt (circular tent) that is built with a wooden frame and cloth cover and is used for insulation. A significant percent of Mongolian families still live in gers. 

Dolgor sews different woolen ropes and covers for gers. The demand for ropes and ger covers increases sharply during the summers, which is the main tourist season. Many tourist camps build new gers for their foreign guests. Dolgar has a contract with a local tourist camp to provide the necessary ropes and covers for all of their gers. She requests a loan to purchase wool and cotton for sewing.

loans.use: To purchase wool and cotton for sewing

loans.name: Aminatu

texts.en:
Aminatu A., 42, is married and blessed with six children, three sons and three daughters. Few of her children are in the junior high school, while others are in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family and especially meet the children’s school demands. Her husband deals in diamonds.

Aminatu is a trader. She buys foodstuff and vegetables such as maize, yam, plantain from nearby smaller communities and sells to food vendors and retailers in her community. Aminatu has been at work for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. Aminatu hopes to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff and vegetables to expand business

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi M. est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Il exerce ce métier depuis 3 ans et il a pu subvenir aux besoins de sa famille avec les revenus issus de son activité. Agé de 30 ans, Komi est marié et père d’un enfant. Il espère avec ce crédit payer une deuxième moto à une tierce personne qui est tenue de lui verser des redevances mensuelles. Ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui permettra de rembourser l’emprunt et épargner une partie pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi M. is a moto taxi driver in Wome. He has been in this business for three years, and he was able to provide for his family with the revenues from it. He is 30 years old, married, and a father with a child. He hopes to use this loan to buy a second moto for a third party, who is obligated to pay monthly fees. This will augment his revenues and enable him to repay the loan and to save some of it, so as to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor bike to rent out

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 41, is the mother of four children. She lives in Mutia, Zamboanga del Norte. Her children are school-aged: two are in college and the others are in high school and elementary school.

She is engaged in buying and selling copra and charcoal to earn enough income for the family. Her husband is a farmer.

In 2006, Marilyn decided to become a member of Paglaum Coop, to accessed a loan for her existing business. During her membership, she successfully paid her loans diligently. She is accessed her third loan in the amount of Php 50,000, to harvest coconut farm land owned by a neighbor, to generate additional income to support the education of her children.

loans.use: Harvest coconut farm land.

loans.name: Rodecinda

texts.es:
Rodecinda es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Rodecinda es casada, tiene 10 hijos D. los cuales 6 viven con ella, Rodecinda se dedica a la compra D. tara, cochinilla, D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días junto a sus hijas. Además Rodecinda viaja  a las ferias los días sábados y domingos a comprar tara.
Rodecinda necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tara y cochinilla.
Los sueños D. Rodecinda es mejorar su negocio, que su ultimo hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rodecinda is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Rodecinda is married, and has 10 children, 6 of which live with her. Rodecinda dedicates herself to selling Tara (an ornamental plant and a source of tannins), and Cochineal insects (used for crimson-colored dye) as an ambulant vendor in the Magdalena market; she carries out this activity every day with her daughters. In addition, Rodecinda travels to markets on Saturdays and Sunday to purchase Tara. Rodencinda needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of Tara and Cochineal. Rodecinda dreams of improving her business, and that her last son finish his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Tara (an ornamental plant and a source of tannins), and Cochineal insects (used for crimson-colored dye).

loans.name: Ankatoallama 3 Group

texts.fr:
Ankatoallama 3 est un regroupement de neuf femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 34 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames  à Soromana, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région administrative (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Après des années de prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne (prêt agricole) et les trois précédents ont été bien  remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt  actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 15 hectares de mil, de fonio et d’arachide et espèrent avoir une production moyenne  de 2 tonnes par hectare soit 30 tonnes.
Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné  pour la nourriture.
Le bénéfice généré de  la vente sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et acheter  les trousseaux de mariage  des filles.
texts.en:
Ankatoallama 3 is an association of nine women who are all married and who average 34 years of age and two children.  They all live in polygamous families in Soromana, a village of the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba in the third administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.  They know one another through ties of kinship and community.  Following years of solidarity loans, all correctly repaid, they are now on their fourth farm loan (agricultural loan).  The three preceding ones were repaid.  They intend to use this current loan for the costs of labor and weeding and for buying seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides.  They want to cultivate 15 hectares of millet, fonio, and peanuts and hope to have an average production of 2 tonnes per hectare, thus 30 tonnes.  Part of the harvest will be sold at the different weekly fairs, and the rest will be for food.  The profit from the sale will be used to make loan interest payments, to cover the costs of schooling and healthcare for the children, and to buy wedding items and accessories for the daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Unique Group

texts.en:
Joseph started his fish and meat business four years ago in a market where he currently lives. He treks to rivers and village hunters to purchase his stock. He buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people buy from him in the marketplace. He is 43 years old, married, and the father of three children. Currently two of the kids are schooling and his first-born is learning a trade. He is asking for the loan to buy increased stocks of assorted fresh fish and bush meat to make increased sales and income to support his children's education and business growth.

Joseph is the one sitting in the red chair in the group photograph. He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Unique’. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They request the loan to upgrade their businesses to increase sales. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk quantities of fish and bush meat

loans.name: Jovanice's Group

texts.en: Jovanice M. is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. She is 56 years old and a widow who cares for four dependents. Jovanice is a teacher by profession and has been a farmer in Rugarama for one year.  One of her strong points is providing good customer service. She works so hard to grow her business and to make sure she has a happy family. Jovanice needs a loan to help modernize her farm by getting quality seeds and to hire manpower to work the farm to ensure that she gets quality production. She is a friendly and determined lady with many dreams to realize.

loans.use: To modernize her farm.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
El Sr. Emiliano Núñez tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. De Jesús hace varios años, tuvieron 11 hijos de los cuales 9 siguen vivos, todos menos la menor de 20 años de edad esta a su cargo y ayuda en su actividad, los demás hijos ya son independientes.
El Sr. Núñez tiene una despensa y también se dedica a la venta de menudencias hace más de 15 años, su esposa e hijas se encargan de la despensa y él trabaja con una camioneta a repartir la menudencia. 
Se inicio con capital propio, anteriormente era albañil de obras y con un ahorro compro una pequeña camioneta y así empezó esta actividad. 
Solicita el crédito para compra de variedad de menudencias y mercaderías varias para la despensa como azúcar, yerba, panificados y bebidas en general.
texts.en:
Emiliano Núñez is 64 years old and has been married to Mrs. De Jesus for many years. They have had 11 children, 9 of whom have survived. The youngest is 20 years old and lives with them and helps in their work, the others are independent. Mr. Núñez has a small grocery store and has also sold other odds and ends for more than 15 years. His wife and children run the store and he drives a truck to distribute goods. He started his business with his own money. Prior to this he worked as a builder, and with his savings, he purchased a small truck and began this job. He is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of goods for his store, such as sugar, herbs, baking supplies and drinks in general.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase goods to sell

loans.name: For Better Group

texts.en:
This is Ngadie K., Sallamatu B. and Adama J.. They called their group For Better (a Krio phrase meaning “for prosperity”). They are petty-traders in Waterloo small town, twenty miles from Freetown. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. They are requesting a loan of Le 1,400,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently they can make better profits and improve on their standards of living.

Ngadie (middle) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-eight years of age and was born in Bo City, in southern Sierra Leone. She is married to a driver and they have four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Ngadie’s primary business is charcoal but she also sometimes sells foofoo (a delicious ball of paste made from ground cassava).

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Saddy Adolfo

texts.es: El joven Saddy Adolfo M. P., tiene la edad de 23 años, habita el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su familia es poder construir su casa ya que actualmente habitan donde su suegro que le brindo un cuarto mientras realizan sus proyectos de vivienda, el joven desde hace cinco años trabaja como agricultor , con el apoyo de su suegro logro establecer una manzana de plátano, agradece a Afodenic por la aprobación de su préstamo ya que todo el fondo va invertir en los insumos que requiere la plantación y  a vez darle el mantenimiento que recomienda el técnico para la buena cosecha .
texts.en:
Saddy Adolfo M. P., age 23, lives in the community of Juan Ramón Padilla with his wife, who works as a domestic in order to help him with the household expenses. His plan for his family is to be able to build a house since currently they live with his father-in-law who offers them a room while they work on their building project. For five years, this young man has worked as a farmer. With the help of his father-in-law he succeeded in establishing a banana grove. He is thankful to Afodenic for approving his loan since he is going to invest all the funds in raw materials required for the plantation and, at the same time, give it the upkeep experts recommend for a good crop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Raquel De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Raquel De Los Ángeles M. M. reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Raquel tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando. El esposo de Raquel se dedica a las ventas de manera ambulante y genera aproximadamente $250.00 US mensuales los cuales son utilizados para costos fijos del hogar, Raquel por su lado apoya por medio de las ganancias obtenidas de su librería, la cual  tiene instalada en su lugar de domicilio. Raquel solicita un crédito para compra nuevos productos para su librería.
texts.en:
Raquel De Los Ángeles lives in the La Libertad department, is 31 years old, and lives with her husband and two children, who are students. Raquel's husband is an itinerant salesman who earns about 250.00 dollars US per month which go towards paying the household's fixed costs. Raquel, for her part, helps out with the profits she earns in her bookstore which is installed in her home. Raquel is asking for a loan to buy new products for her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her bookstore.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Solidarias " están representadas por la señora Leona y conformada por 13 miembros D. socias  muy trabajadoras que van cursando su tercer con expectativas D. seguir creciendo. Las señoras tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo y desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades comerciales como la venta D. ropa interior, cosméticos por catalogo, comida, empanadas, juguetes y entre los varones al transporte publico D. pasajero. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio los socios siempre saben como salir adelante con más esfuerzo y dedicación a su trabajo. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. mercadería e insumos para sus distintas actividades y para la reparación D. sus vehículos como el retapizado D. sus asientos, compra D. repuestos y chaparía que ayudara a generar mejores ingresos para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijos y esposos.
texts.en:
Leona represents the Las Solidarias group. It is comprised of 13 hard-working members. They are in their third cycle, and their expectation is to keep growing. The women have been friends for a long time. They work in different types of commercial activities like selling underwear, cosmetics by catalog, food, empanadas, and toys. The men work in public transportation of passengers. As far as competition goes, it does exist in the neighborhood. The members always know how to get ahead with more effort and dedication to their work. The loan is to get more merchandise and supplies for their different activities. It is also to repair their vehicles by recovering the seats, buying replacement parts, and auto body repair. This will help generate more income to improve the quality of life for their children and spouses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Twesige Group, Kayunga

texts.en:
John N. is the leader of his lending group in Kayunga. He is 30 years old and married with 3 children aged 10, 4, and 2. He takes care of 3 dependants. All of John’s children are in school.

He has a video store in Jinja, Aldina Road that has been operating for 5 years. He has all kinds of movies in stock and rents them out to home users and video halls. He is able to make 80,000 UGX of income per week. He succeeds by ensuring that he always stocks recent movies and by making music CDs and DVDs for his customers.

In the future, John strives to expand his business by opening other branches and hopes to build a house and educate his children. He needs a loan to buy new equipment, like a computer, to provide better service. He is grateful that the loans boost his business.

loans.use: To buy a computer to provide better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying pagnes

loans.name: Virginia Clara

texts.es:
Nuestra socia CLARA tiene 59 años es casada y tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes y ayudan a su mama. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la confección de chompas de forma artesanal. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio de venta de chompas y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida. La socia requiere el préstamo para adquirir más lana para confeccionar más chompas pues por estas fiestas navideñas es donde se vende más.             

La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “HUAYNA CCAPAC” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our associate, Clara, is 59 years old. She is married and has three grown children who help their mother. She alternates her time taking care of the household and making handcrafted sweaters. She has been selling sweaters for several years and she is doing well, thanks to the determination she gives to her work. Our associate is a hard working mother who moves her family forward despite life’s difficulties. She needs this loan to buy more wool yarn to make more sweaters. It’s during the Christmas season that her sales are highest. She is a part of the “HUAYNA CCAPAC comunal bank of the “Arariwa Cusco Provincial Association” of the Department of Cusco. She is thankful for this opportunity and pledges to repay this loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yarn to make sweaters

loans.name: Rugaaga I Twimukye Of Ibanda Group

texts.en:
K. Mackleen is 49 years old and married with six children, all in secondary school. She also takes care of one dependent.

Mackleen is a farmer, selling produce from Rugaaga I, and from her transactions she is able to make 260,000/= (Ugandan Shillings) as profits every week. She has been a farmer selling produce for fourteen years and is grateful that she has been able to win more customers due to her quality produce.

Mackleen needs a loan to help with buying more produce for resale plus employing manpower on her farm for better output.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell and to employ manpower on her farm

loans.name: Erling

texts.es: La señora Erling C. nació en San Carlos en el Año de 1956, vive actualmente en el Barrio Laureles Norte tiene tres hijos y todos son mayores de edad, tiene  una negocio de alquiler de cuartos y vive con su compañero el cual realiza trabajos de casa como radiotécnico apoyándole económicamente a la economía del hogar, ella desea una préstamo para remodelar lo cuartos ya que actualmente son de Plycem y los quiere construir de bloque para brindar mayor seguridad a sus arrendatarios, así mismo lograría mayor calidad, durabilidad y mejor precio de alquiler por los cuartos, esto le permitiría una mejor entrada de dinero ayudándola a mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia y brindándole el capital necesario para nuevos proyectos a futuro.
texts.en:
Señora Erling C. was born in San Carlos in 1956. She currently lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She has 3 children, who are all adults. She has a business renting rooms. She lives with her companion, who does work in houses like electrical work so he can support the home economically. She would like a loan so she can remodel the rooms since they are currently built with plywood. She would like to build them with bricks to offer better security to her tenants. They will also be more durable and of better quality so she can charge a higher price for them. This will let her make more money and help her improve her quality of life and that of her family and to generate the necessary capital for future projects.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel the rooms that she rents out

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Pablo es profesional el cual trabaja para Ceprodel como asesor legal en Esteli y Condega.
Pablo va usar el crédito para la compra de repuesto para su camioneta ( llantas y diferencial) 
El espera que con las llanta y el diferencial nuevo le ayude mucho ya que necesita reparar su camioneta ya que es su herramienta de trabajo.
Pablo es acompañado y no tiene hijo, Este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel Pablo dice que con los crédito anteriores le ayudado mucho a solventar deudas personales.
texts.en:
Pablo is a professional who works with Ceprodel as a legal adviser in Esteli and Condega. Pablo is going to use the loan to pay for repairs to his bus (tires and axle). He hopes that the new tires and axle will help him a lot. He needs to repair his bus because it is his tool for work. Pablo is seeing someone but has no children. This is his second loan with Ceprodel. Pablo says that the previous loans allowed him to resolve a lot of personal debt.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for repairs for bus

loans.name: Zul-Huu

texts.en:
Zul-huu is 26 years old and lives with his wife in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Currently, his wife stays at home. 

In 2003 Zul-huu graduated as a lathe solderer from a college in Ulaanbaatar. From 2005 to 2007 he worked as a solderer at a private company in his own province. From 2007 to 2009 he worked as a solderer and drum master at a goldmine. Since 2009 he has been operating his own soldering business  from his yard.  He is planning to create his own workplace in his yard. 

Zul-huu is a decent and very hardworking person. He says, “I would like to create my own workplace and to concentrate more on my soldering business”.  He is requesting a 415,000 tugrug loan to purchase appliances and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase appliances and materials for his welding business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 33-year-old, hardworking and determined married man. He runs a general shop where he sells cereals, green vegetables, fruit and drinks to his neighbours. He previously sold electronics, before he ventured into this business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya his capital has increased and he has been able to diversify from selling electronics to having a general store. He plans to grow his business and to buy household assets in the future. He has requested a loan of KES 80,000 to add stock of flour, juice, soda, detergent and other products. He has previously taken a loan of KES 140,000 and demonstrated responsibility and punctuality when completing his payments.

loans.use: Add stock of inventory.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina G. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Mailag Valencia City. She is 44 years old. Dina is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Dina owns & operates a business selling a variety of home utensils in the local community. Dina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Dina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mariama T.

texts.en:
Mariama T. K. is married with three children. She started her sales of drinks with funds from her husband. Over the years her business has been doing well little by little and now she intends diversify her goods.

With her four years experience in her trade, Mariama is therefore soliciting a loan to buy more stock and generate more income. As a result, she intends to participate fully in the education of her children, establish a cinema, and construct a dwelling house for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy drinks and and food

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mr. Thy K. is 44 years old and lives in Trapeang Chrey Village, Kandal Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Khloek Buth, are farmers who own a three-hectare field where they cultivate rice to earn a living for their family. In order to support their farm, Mr. Thy K. decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer for plowing and to buy fertilizer and pesticide. This couple has seven children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory while six are students and also help with their parents' farm. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To hire a laborer for plowing and to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy es transportista urbano trabaja en el Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88 de la ciudad de La Paz.  Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz zona de pasankeri.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de motor para su trufi.
 
Es primer crédito con IMPRO. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Freddy works in transportation and works in the Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88 (Eduardo Avaroa Trufi 88 Labor Union) in the city of La Paz. This is his main source of income and his only means of supporting his family. His home is located in the city of La Paz in the pasankeri area.

The loan will be used to buy a motor for his trufi (a taxi with a fixed route).

This is his first loan with IMPRO (Kiva’s field partner). The evaluation that they gave him qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor.

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi M. N. is sixty-two years old. He is married and has seven children who are already adults. He engages in furniture making. Apart from that he also sells eggs, charcoal and cookers. He has been in this business for the last ten years and has four employees. 

Mwangi says the business is good but he has financial constraints and that is why he wants to borrow Kes 40,000 to add more materials for making furniture and the cookers. In furture, he hopes to expand his business and acquire property. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: materials for furniture and cookers

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 63 años, es un padre muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Anita (63) y sus 3 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Desde muy joven, se dedica  al cultivo de café, ya que esta es la actividad que se ha realizado en su familia, desde muchas generaciones atrás. Vende el café a sus compradores fijos, que llegan hasta sus chacras, y ellos  posteriormente llevan el producto a venderlo a la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, ya lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus plantaciones, porque debe realizarlo con cuidado. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para poder incrementar sus plantaciones de café.Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y se compromete a hacerlo, además en su banco comunal es un integrante muy respetuoso con el resto.Luis tiene planeado invertir los  mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, en la compra de más abono y fertilizantes para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Luis is a 63-year-old loving and hard-working father. He lives in his own home with his wife, Anita, also 63, and their three children, who are his motivation in all his endeavors. Since he was very young, Luis has made a living cultivating coffee because that is what his family has done for many generations. He sells his coffee to fixed buyers who come to his farm, and they in turn take the product to the city to sell. What he most enjoys about his work is cultivating his land, and he does it with a lot of care, since he has been doing this activity for 30 years. He considers fumigating his coffee crops as his most difficult task. This is his third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he knows he has to make his payments on time and promises to do so. Luis is a very respected member of his community bank. He plans to invest the loan in the purchase of more compost and fertilizers for the upcoming planting.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost and fertilizers

loans.name: We Are Not Alone Group

texts.en:
Mark L., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'We Are Not Alone'. He is 36 years old, single, and has two children,  4 and 7 years old. 

He is a college student and cares for two siblings. For 10 years, he has been selling tobacco in Redlight Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more tobacco. He describes himself as earnest.

His dream is to improve his business, build a house, and educate his children.  In the photo that accompanies this profile, Lawrence is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more tobacco

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
Dory D. is from the town of Surallah. She is 37 years old and is married with four school-aged children.

Dory is engaged in rice farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than eleven years already. She also started growing and fattening hogs for sale. She says she does her best to provide for her family, especially her children's education. Like any mother, she wants to give them a bright future.

Dory joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Dory is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and feed for her pigs. This loan will be her fourth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Su

texts.en: Su T. N. was born in 1965. She has a store that sells wood furniture. She has two children. Her husband takes part in social organization in her village. Everybody loves him. Her family has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,450,000 VND in order to expand her store.

loans.use: expanding furniture store

loans.name: Yasmina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “HATUN S. ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yasmina, ella tiene  31 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica a  la venta de artesanía, ella trabaja comprando ala por mayor y vendiendo al por menor en su stand ubicado en la av. Sol.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería de tipo artesanal y parte de ellos para sus estudios.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a part of the "Hatun S." communal bank, located in the Huanchac district within the Cusco province and department. Yasmina is 31 years old, lives with her husband, and son. She sells arts and crafts and buys them in quantity to resell from her stand, located on the Sol Avenue. She is asking for this loan so that she can invest part of it art merchandise and part toward her studies. She is grateful and values this loan and also the method by which it was obtained. She is committed to repaying it on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Arts and education

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a single woman with one child who attends school. She rents a house with no electricity but with piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is house rent.

Madina has been operating her business of selling clothes for the last three years, selling from her shop and also selling door-to-door to her neighboring community and to passersby. She has no other source of income. She faces the major challenge of competition as many people sell the same products.

Madina decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation and its easy accessibility to financial services. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase more clothing materials, shoes and handbags. She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials, shoes and handbags

loans.name: Innocent

texts.fr: Innocent N., née à Rubavu ancien préfecture de Gisenyi, aujourd’hui il se trouve en province du Sud district de Musanze-Rwanda, il est marié, il a 47 ans,  son niveau d’éducation est primaire.  Il a 9 enfants, le premier a 24 ans et le cadet a 4ans, huit des ses enfants vont a l’école.  Il habite en district de Rubavu en province de l’Ouest. Il est salarié, il vient de contracter un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano pour réhabiliter sa maison  qui n’est pas en bon état. Il a épargné dans le passé ce lui a permis de construire cette maison laquelle il veut réhabiliter, grâce a ces épargnes il a payé le minerval des ses enfants. Dans l’avenir il veut continuer à mieux payer son prêt  afin de pouvoir bien tenir sa famille aisement
texts.en:
Mr Innocent N. was born in Rubavu, in what was previously the district of Gisenyi and which is currently located in the Southern province of the Musanze-Rwanda district. He is married, 47 years old, and completed primary education. He has nine children between the ages of 24 and 4, eight of whom attend school. He lives in the Rubavu district in the West province. He works, and just received a loan from Amasezerano in order to renovate his home, which is not in good condition. He was able to build this home thanks to money he had previously saved, which also allowed him to pay school fees for his children. In the future, he would like to continue paying his loan in order to take care of his family needs.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate his home

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Madade Mariama D. est une femme de 53 ans. Elle est veuve et mère trois enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de quatre autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ADIAF depuis le 28 juin 2008. Elle a 4 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté.

Elle fait un petit commerce de bananes. Elle achète sa marchandise à bord champ pour revendre dans les marchés environnants. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. 

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, leur nourriture et leur couverture sanitaire
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama D. is 53 years old. She is  a widow and the mother of three. She also has four other children in her care, entrusted to her by relatives. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of ADIAF since June 28, 2008. After joining, she obtained  loans four times and always repaid them without issues.

She sells bananas. She purchases her produce at  groves in order to resell it at nearby markets.

With this new loan she is going to increase her stock level in order to better meet her customers’ needs and increase her profit margin.Her goal is to be able to provide for her children's schooling, food and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchasing banans

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane O. is from the village of Paglaum Village, Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 36 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, and other junk foods in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and provide working capital

loans.name: Prok

texts.en: Prok T., 41, is a low-income farmer living in Kompong Tom Province. Prok T. raises ducks in a cage behind her house for extra income. She is a good and determined single mother who tries her best to feed her three children, even though she has been divorced from her husband for many years. She has one married child who lives separately, while the others are home and work in a variety of jobs. Prok T. has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase more ducks to raise for eggs.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to raise for eggs.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille A. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old. Lucille is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Lucille owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling homemade sausage or chorizzo in the local community. Lucille has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucille joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucille is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lucille from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her ower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make sausages for sale

loans.name: Donato

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Donato; el tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería, el realiza diferentes tipos de muebles como sillas, mesas y ventanas, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera y materiales como pegamentos para realizar los muebles.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the "EL AMANECER" ("The Dawn") loan group, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Donato, 33, lives with his partner and has 2 children. Alongside his daily tasks he runs a carpentry business. He makes different kinds of furniture, such as chairs, tables and windows. He works from 6am to 7pm and thanks to the business he can support his children. He would like to expand his business.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood and materials such as glue to make furniture. He would like to thank those helping him achieve his dream, and is committed to repaying the loan in the terms agreed.

loans.use: The partner is requesting a loan to buy wood and materials, such as glue, to make furniture.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Enhtsetseg M. is a single mother who lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her son, age 16, attends university in a foreign country. Enhtsetseg operates a clothes retail business in the city. She has engaged in this business since 1996 and has built up a stable and successful operation over many years. In the future she hopes to continue to operate her business at a sustainable level. She plans to buy a large amount of clothing items at wholesale prices in order to sell those items as a retailer in December. She is a modest and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase and import winter clothes such as suits, coats, outerwear etc from China in order to increase her working capital for her business.

loans.use: To purchase and import winter clothes

loans.name: Fideri

texts.en: Fideri is a thirty-year-old married man with three children, and he owns a house in Kasese. He has been in agriculture for the last ten years. He started with tomato farming on a small scale, but later diversified into many crops such as rice, maize, potatoes and beans. His hardships include climatic changes, pests, diseases and price fluctuations. His vision is to have a bigger and more stable commercial farm, plus a well educated and business oriented family. Federi intends to use the loan to buy seeds and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Daysi Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Eduardo, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Parque Ecológico, este lugar es conocido porque aquí hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy visitado por los turistas y personas de la localidad que quieren pasar un dia en contacto con la naturaleza.

La señora Daysi  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, le gusta por la ayuda y por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad, el mayor estudia en Universidad y el menor en colegio que es el que aun viven con ella.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta,  vende a través de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja cinco días a la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo o si no viaja a   Guayaquil cuando puede para traer más variedad de sus  productos, nos cuenta que lo que ella mas vende es ropa de mujer, además que tiene muchos clientes ya que ya lleva con su negocio por más de 15 años en los cuales les ha llevado buenos productos a sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, y ropa de temporada playera como trajes de baño, entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of San Eduardo, in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the “Ecological Park” Community Bank meet every fifteen days. This place is known for it’s beautiful park, which is visited by many tourists and local people that want to spend a day in a natural setting. 
Mrs. Daysi is a founding member of the Community Bank. She is liked for her helpfulness and her ability to obtain loans. She is 46 years old, married and from this marriage she has two children, 22 and 18 years old. The oldest studies at the University and the youngest is in high school. The youngest still lives at home. 
Mrs. Daysi sells all types of clothes door to door. She delivers the clothes after customer requests. She gets paid each week. She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo if she doesn’t go to Guayaquil where she can find a greater variety of products. She mostly sells women’s clothes. She has had some customers for over fifteen years as she provides good products for her customers.
This loan will be used to buy more clothes, mostly women’s clothes such as pants, blouses and clothes for the beach season such as bathing suits, among other items. Her dream is to be successful.

loans.use: She will buy women's clothes such as blouses, pants, bathing suits, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Tuon Mouv Village Bank Group

texts.en: Located in Pris Leu village, Takeo province, this village bank group consists of eleven people led by Mrs. Tuon M., the village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their families. Mrs. Tuon M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family and she is also a rice seller. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Tuon M. is applying for a loan to buy more rice to resell. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, and another one is a laborer, and the other is a student.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 37-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 22,000 to fund operations. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Carmelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Revayet

texts.ru: Revayet H. 20 let. On ne jenat. Revayet yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Yeqo mama boleyet i poeotmu krome raboti on yeshe i delayet domashniye raboti chtobi mama nene ustavala. Revayet uje 2 qoda kak imeyet magazin qde prodayet vrukti i ovoshi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit frukti i ovoshi dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Revayet H. is 20 years old.  He is single.  Revayet is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city, and now he and his parents live in the Fuzuli region.  His mother is ill, and therefore Revayet also does all of the housework so his mother does not become too tired.  For two years, Revayet has had a shop where he sells fruit and vegetables.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sope Serigne Barra2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BARRA2 est créé en 2006. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Le groupe est né par liens de cohabitation et de parenté. Leur union est également soutenu par une conscience mutuelle dans l'entre-aide et la solidarité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR MBAR. (nb. Khady B. n'apparaissant bien sur la photo est considérée comme absente)   

Madame ADAMA F. (à l'extrême droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 02 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des amis et proches. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle achète des moutons à engraisser pendant au moins quatre mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter deux moutons pour réaliser son projet d'embouche

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille en nourriture, santé et scolarité des enfants
texts.en: The Sope Serigne Barra2 solidarity group was created in 2006.  It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same neighborhood.  The group was born through cohabitational and parental ties.  Their union is also supported by a common belief in mutual aid and solidarity.  The group is a part of the Keur Mbar Banc Villageois (note. Khady B., who does not appear in the photo, was considered absent).  Madame Adame F. (at the extreme right of the photo) is the leader of the group.  She is 32 years old.  She is married and the mother of 3 children.  She also cares for 2 other children who have been entrusted to her by her close friends and family members.  She fattens sheep.  She buys the sheep to fatten at least four months before re-selling them in the monthly markets.  This new loan will allow her to purchase two sheep in order to fulfill her fattening project.  Her objective is to participate in paying for the daily expenses of her family in food, clothing, and education for the children.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep

loans.name: Mihinsiensien Group

texts.en:
The Mihinsiensien group consists of 4 longstanding friends. This is their third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments. They have agreed to support each other in business and through loan repayments.

Kai (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1974 in Lome, the capital of neighboring Togo. She now lives in Calavi on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She and her husband Cyniaque support their three children, all of whom have received their education.

Since the age of 11, Kai has helped in a general store and she now runs a stall selling various household and personal goods. This loan will enable her to purchase bowls, shoes and tissues from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim in the long term is to increase her scope of products. Her strongest point as an entrepreneur is her ability to satisfy customers.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls, shoes, and tissues for resale

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Rosa Amelia le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior con es pintar y poner una losa de concreto al frente de la casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagar a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora que su casa esta necesitando.
Plana pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene su esposo el señor Carlos de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes como chofer de un camión de carga. 
Desean que sus dos hijos tengan un patrimonio seguro y en mejores condiciones
texts.en: Rosa Amelia's house needs some finishing touches making to the outside such as painting and laying a concrete slab out front.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy the material and pay the person who will carry out the improvements that her house needs.  She plans to repay her loan with some of the income that her husband Carlos makes from his job working as a truck driver for a transport company.  Rosa and her husband want their children to have a secure patrimony which is in better condition.

loans.use: to make some finishing touches to the outside of her home and to pay somebody to carry out the work

loans.name: Segundo Aurelio

texts.es:
Segundo de 53 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su trabajo hace 30 años como oficial y después como ayudante de tráiler y así fue ascendiendo su puesto.

En la actualidad trabaja transportando cargas solo 2 días a la semana y uno descansa en todo el día. Le afecta en su trabajo la delincuencia ya que la ciudad donde transporta sus cargas son peligrosas. Su esposa es ama de casa y tienen 5 hijos solo uno de ellos estudia. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como hierro cemento arena. En un futuro desea buscar otra forma que conseguir ingresos independientes.
texts.en:
Segundo is 53 years old.  He is a hard-working man who started working 30 years ago as a skilled worker and then as an assistant truck driver, receiving promotions in his work.

Segundo currently works transporting freight only two days a week and one day he rests all day.  He is affected by crime in his work since the cities where he transports his cargo are dangerous.  His wife is a housewife and they have five children only one of whom is in school.  Segundo would like to use his loan to buy building supplies such as iron, cement and sand.  In the future, he would like to look for another way of making independent income.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is now 53 years old and married with five adult-aged children. Yolanda is a duck raiser working in the Philippines and earns approximately PHP 4,000 per month. 

Yolanda is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase ducks bearing eggs and feed for their maintenance. Yolanda has been raising ducks for almost 15 years.

In the future, Yolanda hopes to strengthen this kind of business as one source of their income in order to improve their living status and satisfy their daily basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and feed

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nzaro

texts.en:
Nzaro is a married a man with 15 children, 6 of whom still attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for his children.

Nzaro has been operating a quarry business for the last four years, selling to local residents in his area. In addition, he also operates a café business to earn additional income. Nzaro faces a major challenge in the seasonality of his business. During the December holidays, he has a lot of customers, but during the months of January to May he experiences low sales volume. Nzaro dreams of expanding his business and operating it as a wholesale business in the future.

With this loan for 20,000 KES, Nzaro wants to purchase a quarry machine and add food stock for his café business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his businesses.

loans.use: to buy a machine for his quarry business and add food stock for his café business

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka is 30 years old and married with five children. Peka owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Peka needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase knives, spades, wheel-barrow and sacks of fertilizers to expand and improve her business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Peka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Peka's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase knives, spades, wheel-barrow and sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Vieng

texts.en: Mrs. Vieng is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. She sells some goods such as Khmer cakes and corn on the ferry dock, earning around US $2.50 each day. To share the financial expenses, her husband is employed as a casual construction worker. They have two children; one works as a hairdresser at a beauty salon, generating about $2.50 per day to contribute to the family's expenses. Mrs. Vieng will be using her loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband to ride to work as his existing one broke. She will use the balance of the loan to purchase extra cakes and corn to sell.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her husband to ride to work

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 54 years old, married and has 8 adult children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products. She has been doing this work for 15 years and earns approximately Php 5,000 monthly.

Veronica is requesting a loan of Php 13,000 to purchase soft drinks, bread, noodles and canned goods to sell.

In the future, Veronica hopes that she will earn more income to meet the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 36 years old. He is a hardworking and determined businessman. He is married and blessed with 5 children, four of whom are in school.  For the last 18 years, he has been doing quarrying to provide for his family. Previously he used to sell second-hand clothes.  His dream is to have established a construction company in the next five years.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a wheelbarrow, mattocks and mallet. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has developed a saving culture and gained business management skills.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, mattocks and mallet

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 44 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de 6 filhos de 3 aos 27 anos de idade. Três é que vão a Escola, fez a 2ª classe não concluiu devido ao tempo porque seu pai obrigava lhe a passar a maior parte do tempo trabalhando na machamba, vive na casa própria.
Começa a fazer negócio de pequena escala vendendo pasteis nas esquinas da escola, mas com ajuda do seu marido consegue aranjar uma banca no Mercado Central onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade tais como( tomate, cebola, cenoura e arroz) tem gastado uma média de 8.000.00mt nas compras e tendo de lucro 3.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da obra. Vende, tambem, refeições no Mercado( sopa) diariamente  consegue ter 350mt. Conta  tambem com ajuda do seu marido. 
Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o volume dos seus produtos, o anterior de 5.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt foi usado para o negócio, pagou com muito sucesso, esta cofiante que fara o mesmo neste segundo para aceder a mais empréstimos pois gostaria tanto de ajudar sua filha que se encontra desempregada.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Namaacha District. She is 44 years old, is married and has six children between 3 and 27 years old. Three of the children go to school. Maria finished second grade but did not have time to finish school because her father made her spend most of her time working on their farm. She lives in her own house.

She began a small business selling turnovers at the corners by the school, but with her husband's help she was able to get a stand at the Central Market where she sells basic goods like tomatoes, onions, carrots and rice. She has spent an average of 8,000 meticais on her purchases and has a profit of 3,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses and construction. Maria also sells meals (soups) daily and earns 350 meticais. She also relies on her husband's help.

This is her third loan with Hluvuku. She is asking for 10,000 meticais to increase her inventory. The earlier loans were for 5,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais and were used for her business. She paid them off successfully and is confident that she will do the same on this loan so she can get more loans, as she would really like to help her daughter, who is currently unemployed.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (rice, onions, sugar and other items).

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. Ana es casada, tiene 3 hijos todos en edad escolar; ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa, la Sra. Ana es muy emprendedora quiere crecer aun mas con su negocio; el crédito solicitado lo va a utilizar en la compra de un carrito sanguchero, accesorios y mesas para su nuevo negocio el cual va a ser la venta de sanguches, salchipapas y salchipollos y va a funcionar todas las noches, es un re préstamo Kiva. La Sra. Ana tiene el sueño de tener un gran restaurante en su casa. Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Mrs. Ana is married. She has three school-aged children and sells food in her home. Mrs. Ana is very enterprising and wants her business to grow even more. She will use the requested loan in the purchase of a food cart, accessories and tables for her new business which will be selling sandwiches, salchipapas [fried potatoes with hot dog], and salchipollo [fried potatoes with chicken]. She will run this business every night. This is a Kiva loan. Mrs. Ana dreams of having a large restaurant in her home. She is very grateful for the authorized loan.

loans.use: to purchase a food cart and tables for her new business.

loans.name: Baptista

texts.en:
Baptista is 34 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Luweero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 4 children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Baptista has a business of selling soft drinks.  He has had this business for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Baptista has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase soft drinks, like water, for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Baptista hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Baptista hopes to expand his business.  Baptista is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, like water, for resale

loans.name: Lican Rayen Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Lican Rayen” está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa usada, nueva, venta de verduras, venta de artículos para el cabello, venta de quesos, venta de joyas de plata, venta de perfumes, preparación de comida rápida y tejidos. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Marcela integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, en el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, a quien se le ve solo el rostro y su chaqueta color negro. 
Se dedica a preparar productos de repostería, entre los cuales prepara alfajores, kuchen, brownie, cocadas, queques, pasteles y tortas. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 3 años. Sus ventas las realiza a pedido y  desde hace un año comenzó vendiendo  de manera ambulante, afuera de colegios, todos sus productos de repostería son realizados por porción, sin embargo también realiza pedidos más grandes para eventos. Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio.
Su mercadería para sus preparaciones la compra en una distribuidora.
Con el crédito comprará ingredientes para sus productos de repostería, específicamente, galletas, productos de decoración y  para envolver sus productos. Ya que se acerca la temporada de fiestas patrias y debe prepara una gran cantidad de productos. 
Sus metas en su negocio son estabilizarse en un local establecido, por lo que espera adquirir un kiosco. 
Marcela vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 12 y 3 años de edad, ambos asisten al colegio y jardín infantil.
Sus sueños son ampliar su negocio y tener una pastelería en la cual pueda ofrecer y vender sus productos de repostería. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le han servido para invertir en su negocio, además de generar nuevas estrategias en sus ventas, debido también a las facilidades de pago que se le brinda a las personas emprendedoras. 
Marcela se siente muy cómoda y contenta del Grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece, ya que han demostrado ser comprometidos y unidos. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Lican Rayen." It is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who work in different fields, including selling new and second-hand clothing, vegetables, haircare products, cheese, silver jewelry, perfumes, fabrics and fast food. They are all from Temuco city.

Marcela is a member of the communal bank. In the photo she can be seen in the second row, second from the left. Only her face and black jacket are visible.

Marcela works at preparing baked goods, including alfajores (sweet cookies with a filling), kuchen (German-style cakes), brownies, coconut candies, cakes, pastries and tarts. This has been her work for the last three years. She sells her goods to order, and for the last year she has been selling them as a street vendor, outside schools. All her baked goods are sold in portions, but she also caters for larger orders for events. She says that her business is doing very well.

She buys her supplies from a distributor.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her baked goods, especially, cookies, decorating products and wrapping,  because the independence day holidays are approaching and she has to prepare lots of products.

Her business goals are to establish herself in business premises, so she would like to acquire a kiosk.
Marcela lives with her husband and two children, 12 and 3 years old, who attend school and kindergarten respectively.

Her dreams are to expand her business and have a bakery where she can sell her baked goods.
She is very happy and grateful for the services provided by Kiva Field Partner, Fondo Esperanza, because they have allowed her to invest in her business and come up with new sales strategies. This has also been made possible by the payment facilities offered to entrepreneurs.

Marcela is very comfortable and happy with the communal bank group to which she belongs, as the members have proved themselves to be committed and united.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670km south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). It is close to a number of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and there is outstanding native flora and fauna concentrated in nearby nature parks. Note that 50% of Chile's indigenous people, the Mapuche, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her baked goods, especially, cookies, decorating products and wrapping.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for his small business in order to make dairy products.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman with three children, all of whom have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a food business for the past eight years. Her clients are local area residents and school students. She also sells brooms, which contributes to her income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality--there are no sales when the schools are closed. She dreams of starting a café in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase potatoes, cassavas and material for making brooms. She decided to join Yehu because the terms and conditions are favorable and they satisfy her personal needs.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, cassavas and material for making brooms.

loans.name: Safuli

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia  de Cabo Delgado, norte  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Cabo Delgado para Maputo no distrito de Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida, trabalha como serralheiro ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 8.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição.
