Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (areia,  blocos, cimento, pedra e outros).   
No futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para construir uma oficina para aumentar o seu rendimento.
texts.en:
Safuli was born in the province of Cabo Delgado in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children, three of whom still attend school. He went to school through seventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

He left Cabo Delgado for Maputo in the district of Boane in search of a better life. He's been a locksmith for more than 10 years and earns about 8,500 meticals a month. He uses his earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in his bank account.
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his second loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, stone, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to complete his house and furnish it.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, stone, etc.) for his house.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is a 35-year-old single man. He owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for himself and electricity bills.

Kumba has operated a boutique for the past 15 years. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces the major challenge of seasonality, where demand is high during the festive seasons. He dreams of expanding his business.

With this KES 20,000 loan, Kumba wants to purchase more clothes to resell. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it is a good financial service provider.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Silvana Alexandra

texts.es:
Silvana de 35 años, una mujer honrada y que a pesar de ser madre soltera ha podido salir adelante con sus hijos.
Su actividad es la venta de productos de belleza como cremas anti arrugas, base, delineador, etc.
Su actividad la realiza de lunes a domingos, en cualquier hora del día.
Su dificultad es la delincuencia de su zona, ya que al repartir sus productos se le hace complicado.
Tiene dos hijos uno 7 y 14 años, estudian en escuelas públicas.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio y para surtir con otra clase de mercadería como ropa de hombre y de mujer, interiores.
Su anhelo es que sus hijos puedan terminar sus carreras escolares.
texts.en: Silvana is 35 years old. She is an honest woman and despite being a single mother, she has been able to get ahead with her children. She sells beauty products such as anti-wrinkle cream, foundation, eyeliner, etc. She works Mondays through Sundays, all hours of the day. The problem she faces is the crime in the neighbourhood which makes it difficult for her when she distributes her products. She has 2 children, one is 7 and the other 14 years old. They both attend public schools. She is asking for a loan to invest in her business and stock up on other types of merchandise such as ladies and men's clothing, underwear. Her desire is that her children be able to complete their school careers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, eyeliner, etc.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with eight children, three of whom still attend school while the others have completed their education. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. Chizi owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Chizi has operated a meat goat selling business for the past five years; her potential clients are the people at the slaughter. She faces a major challenge of livestock disease which sometimes leads to death. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 35,000, she wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Antonine

texts.en: Antonine is married and blessed with three children who are in school. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. For the last thirteen years, she has been selling sweets and biscuits to support her family. She also rents houses for more income. Her potential customers are the passersby. Antonine has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more sweets and biscuits for resale. In the next five years, she hopes to become more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy sweets and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Waliou Olakoudé

texts.fr: Waliou Olakoudé est âgé de 56 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Moudjibath. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Waliou Olakoudé a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Waliou Olakoudé exerce l’activité de meunier à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Dans le but de se ravitailler en pièces de rechange pour son moulin et en gasoil, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle dans un bref délai, Waliou Olakoudé sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Waliou Olakoudé s’approvisionne dans sa région. Les trois premiers crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Waliou Olakoudé is 56 years old and married to a merchant named Moudjibath. The couple has two children of whom one goes to school. In addition to their children, the couple has another child under their care. Waliou Olakoudé stopped going to school at the primary level. The couple takes care of their diverse family responsibilities together.

For about twenty years, Waliou Olakoudé has been working as a miller from home, which allows him to meet the needs of himself and his family. With the goal of getting fresh supplies of spare parts for his mill and diesel fuel, in order to better meet the requirements of his clientèle with a brief delay, Waliou Olakoudé is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the fourth time. Waliou Olakoudé gets his supplies in his region. The first three loans previously received were properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and diesel fuel.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn (pictured above), 25, and his wife, Samoeun, 24, live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter.  

Saroeurn produces jars for sale. His wife is a hired farmer who gets paid a wage. Saroeurn is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a remoque to carry his jars for sale. He will also use a part of the loan to purchase materials needed in his business. 

A remoque, as it is called by Cambodian people, is a motorbike with a trailer attached at the back.

loans.use: To buy a remoque (motorbike with a trailer) to carry his jars for sale.

loans.name: Cruy

texts.en:
Mrs. Cruy is shown in the photo in front of her house in Prey Chor district. She has been involved in an agricultural business, growing rice. She is now 52 years old and has seven children. 4 of them are married and lived independently. 
Mrs. Cruy would like to ask for a loan from HKL to buy timber to elevate her house to a higher position. She is very happy that the loan will be granted to fix her house. In the future, she plans to buy extra farmland to increase her rice output.

loans.use: to buy timber to elevate her house to a higher position.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 44 years old, married man with 4 children aged between 5 and 17 years old. They all go to school. He has farmed for the past 7 years and will use the loan from kiva, to pay who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions and pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay who harvested maize.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia lives in Altamira Tamaulipas. She is 42 years old and married. She has 4 daughters; some of them are studying at the university. She had been working before her husband’s illness, which caused her to leave her job for a while. When time passed and her husband recuperated, his salary didn\\\'t cover all the household expenses. One day he gave her 50 pesos for the meals of that day. This wasn’t enough so she went to a candy store and bought some products then sold them outside a school. With the 50 pesos invested she earned 100 pesos. That is how Silvia started her grocery store.

She needs a loan of $475 USD to purchase merchandise to increase the variety of her products, grow her customer base, and raise her income. She and her family need your support and generosity.

** Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Silvia vive en Altamira Tamaulipas, tiene 42 años de edad y esta casada, tiene 4 hijas y algunas se encuentran estudiando la universidad. Ella inicio su negocio ante el problema que su esposo enfermo y entonces tuvo que dejar de trabajar por algún tiempo. Cuando el tiempo paso y su esposo se recupero, su salario no le permitía cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar, por lo que un día el le dio $50 pesos para la comida de ese día, el dinero no era suficiente y entonces fue a una dulcería y compro algunos productos, los vendió afuera de de una escuela y con los 50 pesos invertidos gano 100 pesos mas. De esta forma Silvia empezó su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella requiere de $475 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita aumentar la variedad de sus productos en venta y de esta manera incrementar sus clientes, así como sus ingresos. Ella y su familia requieren de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Doris Suyapa

texts.en:
For four years I have sold clothes in my community's market. This market is the most visited in the city. This is an advantage for me; I can sell my clothes everyday. At this moment I want to expand my business by providing bathing suits, sandals, and sunglasses; thus, I can supply the locals, who frequent beaches, with summer clothes. My children help me on weekends--our most profitable time. Their participation is a way for them to contribute to familial expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace cuatro anos me dedico a la venta de ropa en el mercado de mi comunidad, este mercado es el mas visitado en la ciudad es una ventaja para mi, ya que todos los dias puedo vender mi ropa. En este momento quiero surtir el negocio con trajes de bano, sandalias, y lentes de sol ya que las personas siempre salen de paseo a las playas y comprar su ropa de verano. Mis hijos me ayudan los fines de semana que es cuando mas ventas tenemos, asi ellos tambien colaboraran con para poder cubrir con todos los gastos de la familia.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, pants, socks, undergarments, etc.

loans.name: Dora Isolina

texts.en:
My name is Dora Isolina, my main work is in sales. I own a small shop, located in my own home which provides me enough income to help my family. I have been in this business for various years, but now I need to buy more supplies in order to offer a greater variety to my clients. This way, I can increase my income and raise my family's standard of living.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Dora Isolina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de Pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitación, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis cliente y de esa forma mejorar los ingresos y el nivel de vida de mi familia.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, rice, lard, soap, chicken,  instant soup, flour and dairy products

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Mr. Esteban F. Lezme is 44 years old and lives with his 4 children and their mother. Three of his children are studying in a private school in the neighborhood while the oldest is married with his own family. Esteban works producing bread; two of his children and their mother work with him.

Esteban makes his bread in the bakery in his house and later he sells it to shops or right in his own bakery. His client following, already well developed, is composed primarily of people from his neighborhood. He started his business four years ago thanks to a loan from Fundación Paraguaya.

From the start the loan gave him, he went on growing little by little, buying new products and equipment to make his work easier and to optimize both his sales and his production. He comments that he wakes many mornings at 4 AM so that he can prepare his products, load his vehicle and be ready to distribute his bread while it is still early.

He needs the loan to buy an oven, since his oven is quite old and is not functioning well. A new oven will allow him to increase his bread production.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Esteban F. Lezme tiene 44 años, vive en pareja y tiene 4 hijos. Tres de sus hijos están estudiando en un colegio privado del barrio y la mayor está casada y ya formo su propia familia. El señor se dedica a la fabricación de panes y trabaja con su familia (él, su señora y dos de sus hijas).

El Señor fabrica sus panes en su local que se encuentra en su propia casa y luego los vende a despensas o en su mismo local. Su clientela, ya formada, está compuesta mayormente por gente del barrio. Hace cuatro años ya emprendió su propio negocio y lo empezó gracias a un préstamo de la Fundación Paraguaya.

De ahí fue creciendo poco a poco, comprando cada vez nuevos productos y maquinarias para facilitar su trabajo y para optimizar tanto su venta como su producción. Comenta que se despierta todas las mañanas a las 4 para así cargar sus productos para el reparto en su vehículo para así poder ir a distribuir desde ya temprano.

Requiere del crédito para comprar un horno, pues el que tiene porque no está funcionando bien ya que es muy viejo por lo que desea adquirir uno nuevo. Necesita así del crédito para comprar un nuevo horno para así aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Buy a new oven

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna L. is divorced with a son. She lives in Kharkov and sells children’s footwear and clothing in the market of Barabashovo. Anna purchases her inventory from wholesalers and then sells it at retail prices. She has been in this business for 8 years. Anna has fully repaid 10 loans she has received from Nadiya Ukraine. Currently, her turnover capital is about $7000. 

Anna would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital and purchase seasonal inventory for the fall season. She is always looking for ways to promote the growth of her business and to stay competitive in the market. Anna believes that timely financial assistance will help her business develop and expand which will ultimately improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: Increase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Yeti

texts.en: Yeti is 45 years old and is married. To supplement her husband's income, Yeti runs a playstation rental in her house, and Yeti can earn $3 per day. Her husband, Syaripudin has no fixed income.  Yeti is a member of MBK and is asking for a IDR 900,000 loan to expand her business. She hopes to earn more income to use for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Zacarias Alface

texts.pt:
Zacarias Alface B. is 44 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Mahotas. He has his business in the Magoanine market. He is married and lives with his 6 children. Zacarias joined the credit program in 2006 in a group, now he is requesting the loan individually. He requests 5000MT to be repaid in 6 months. He sells food products, and plans on using the loan to replenish his stock which he lost when he was robbed recently.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Zacarias Alface B., portador do BI nº003038455,de 44 anos de idade residente no bairro das mahotas ,tem o seu negocio no mercado Magoanine, vive maritalmente, tem 6 filhos , entrou no programa em 2006 como elemento do grupo agora vai tomar sozinho o emprestimo no valor de 5000 para pagar em 4 meses vende produtos almentares deversos, com o dinheiro pretende aplicar na sua banca visto que ele sofreu um roubo para poder se manter precisa desse dinheiro.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en: Ikhlas is a 47-year-old mother of 3. She lives with her family in Aley. Ikhlas does crochet work and other kinds of handicrafts. She is supporting her family with the revenues of her business. This is the fifth time Ikhlas is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary material to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy material for her business.

loans.name: Juraboy

texts.en:
Juraboy M. lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has four children. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. His past loans have enabled him to greatly improve his business.

He is engaged in the raising and selling of livestock .Mr. M. is also the machinist for the collective farm. Mr. M. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase mixed fodder for his large flock.

loans.use: To purchase mixed fodder for raising livestock

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza is a devoted mother that struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. When she moved to Jauja after she was married she got the idea to start raising small farm animals to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in their land for this business. Slowly the numbers of little pigs and chickens increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza, es una madre abnegada que se esfuerza día a día para ofrecer lo mejor a su familia, cuando se mudó a Jauja luego de haber contraído matrimonio no tuvo mejor idea que dedicarse a criar animalitos pequeños para contribuir con la economía de su hogar aprovechando el espacio disponible de su hogar para esta actividad.Poco a poco la cantidad de cerditos y gallinitas se ha ido incrementando de la misma manera que las solicitudes de sus clientes, por su inmensa lista de peticiones ha decidido incrementar la cantidad de animalitos y a esa razón atiende la solicitud de un préstamo.

loans.use: Compra de mayor cantidad de animalitos.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S. is 63 years old and runs a small grocery store out of her home in Kampong Cham province. Her husband, Man Chim, works with her in their store. They earn on average US $7.20 per day. Both of their children are grown up and living outside of the family home. She wants to buy groceries in bulk because she feels that expanding her inventory will attract more business as time goes on.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Kimsong Sim Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsong S., the group leader, is a fisherman but his business is not growing because he has insufficient equipment. This is why Mr. Kimsong S. decided to apply for a loan to purchase five more fishing nets for his business.

He is 42 years old and the father of four children. One of his children is a construction worker while the others all attend school. His wife, Mrs. Syden E., is a fish seller and sometimes she assists him out on the lake.

loans.use: To purchase five new fishing nets

loans.name: London 2014-F Group

texts.en:
Hellen M., the group leader, has a small business selling local brew and has applied for this loan in order to build a house for her family. Hellen is 40 years old and is a widow. She has six children between the ages of 4 and 27; those of school age attend school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Medina J., Roda F., Joice A., and Mary K.. Medina J. has a business selling clothes and wants to increase the stock of clothes for sale. Roda F. currently has a business selling bread and would use this loan to begin a vegetable garden. Joice A. sells milk and biscuits and would like to expand her shop. Mary K. has a business selling charcoal and has requested this loan in order to buy more charcoal.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr:
Born around 1952 in Cotonou, Ms. Pierrette G. is a widow and the mother of five. Currently, she has responsibility for two children: Rachelle (age 28) who is an apprentice in hairdressing, and Emilienne (age 25) who has an associate's level degree and is lacking work. Since her husband's death, she by herself ensures her family is supported, thanks to the income derived from her business. She sells firewood and makes a fair income. She resides in Abokicodji, a district of Cotonou, and has had this business for over 40 years. She is requesting her fifth loan in the amount of 250,000 francs CFA in order to have an inventory capable of meeting her customers' expectations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1952 à Cotonou, dame G. Pierrette est veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Actuellement, elle a à sa charge deux enfants Rachelle âgée de 28 ans et apprentie coiffeuse et Emilienne 25 ans et diplômée sans emploi niveau (BAC + 2). Depuis la mort de son mari elle assure seule les charges familiales grâce aux revenus qu'elle tire de son activité. Elle vend du bois de chauffage et en tire un revenu non négligeable. Elle réside à Abokicodji un quartier de Cotonou et exerce cette activité depuis plus de 40 ans. Elle sollicite son cinquième crédit d'un montant de 250 000F CFA afin de pouvoir constituer un stock pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 8 small truck loads of firewood

loans.name: Subira's Wache Waseme Group

texts.en:
Subira O. is 26 years old and married, with a 1-year-old child. She owns a small beauty salon and also sells clothing. Subira started doing business in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. in the salon.

Subira now hopes for a loan of $975 to buy more salon items and more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in tailoring, clothing sales, chicken, and food sales.

loans.use: To buy more salon items and more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Desde muy pequeño está familiarizado con la agricultura, gracias a sus padres sabe cómo  trabajar la tierra, ahora está dedicado netamente a la producción de maíz, que realiza durante todo el día, ocupándose en limpiar, regar y sobre todo a abonar sus terrenos, para que su producción sea adecuada.Dentro de su actividad como agricultor siempre le agradó limpiar sus terrenos, porque es algo muy importante y liviano, lo más difícil es cuando las lluvias atraen moquitos que perjudican sus plantas, para ello tiene que adquirir insecticidas para combatir esta amenaza.
Walter desea mejorar la calidad de vida de los miembros de su hogar, siendo esto el motivo de su ardua labor.
Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de abono e insecticidas para afrontar  las diversas adversidades de la naturaleza, con el fin de tener a unos meses la mejor producción de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Walter is 30 years old and lives with his wife and their 4 children. He has been very familiar with agriculture since he was young; thanks to his parents he knows how to work the land. Now he supports himself entirely from corn production. He works all day cleaning, irrigating and fertilizing his fields so that his production will be good. He has always liked cleaning his fields because it is important and is lighter work than many of his tasks. The most difficult part of his work comes when the rains attract mosquitos that damage his plants. He has to buy insecticides to combat that threat.

Walter wants to improve his family's quality of life; that wish provides the motivation for his arduous work. He will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer and insecticides to help him face nature's diverse threats, with the aim to have the best production in his community in a few months.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and insecticides for his crops.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena M. is 44 years old and is married with three children. She has three years of experience producing and selling taro and bananas. She sells to the village people and general public three days per week. She has had four previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (approximately 187 USD). SPBD loans are Filomena's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She hopes to use this loan to continue to send her kids to school and church. Her husband is also fully engaged with the business.

loans.use: To buy taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals, a shovel and barbed wire.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.es: Sabrina tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Siempre ha buscado las salidas para afrontar las carencias económicas en su hogar, es así que encontró una buena alternativa, la de la crianza de cuyes, desde hace 5 años, cada día  trabaja en su granja, alimentando y limpiando sus galpones, los fines de semana vende sus cuyes a una feria cercana a su localidad, para que de esa manera, le genere recursos económicos, también saca la alfalfa de sus propias tierras de cultivo, donde ha sembrado alfalfa, por ello sale todas las mañanas a recoger pasto. En la actualidad está superando un momento difícil en su granja, porque fue invadida por una enfermedad que le hizo perder gran cantidad de cuyes. Sabrina trabaja porque desea seguir siendo un sostén más en la economía de su hogar. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar más cuyes reproductores y mejorar la infraestructura de su granja.
texts.en:
Sabrina is 29-years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She always seeks ways to shore up the gaps in the family’s income and so she found a good alternative in raising guinea pigs. For the past 5-years, each day she works on the farm, feeding and cleaning the barns and during the weekend she sells the guinea pigs at the market in their village and in doing so she gains economic resources. Also, she collects alfalfa grown on her farm that she herself planted.

In actuality, she is overcoming a vert difficult time on the farm, because a disease had overtaken her large part of her live stock causing her to lose many guinea pigs. Sabrina works because she wants to remain the provider for her family. This loan request will allow her to buy more breeding guinea pigs and improve the infrastructure of her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy breeding guinea pigs and improve the sheds for breeding.

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr:
Madame S. Viviane est née en 1970 à Lomé, la capitale de Togo. Elle est célibataire et mère de deux (2) enfants.  Elle a pour activité la coiffure et la vente des sacs de sortie dans le quartier d’Agoè. 
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES et a bien remboursé.
Ce deuxième crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 sacs de sortie et 50 pièces de mèches.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mrs. Viviane S. was born in 1970 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is single and the mother of two children. Her business is hairdressing and the sale of handbags in the area of Agoè. She has previously benefited from a WAGES loan and repaid it in full. This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 20 handbags and 50 hair extension pieces. With this new stock her sales will increase and she will earn a good profit.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of handbags and hair extension pieces

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya M. is 40 years old, married and the mother of four kids. Currently, all her kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood. She sells in a community called Ejura, where the major occupations are crop farming, including maize, groundnuts [peanuts] and the like, because of the fertility of the land. 

She has been selling yams for almost thirty years to support her family. Mariya started this business with her mother when she was a child. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with direct supply of yams. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to serve her customers, especially for the Christmas festivities and for the New Year. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. 

Mariya is a member of a community group called “Rely on God” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rukshana Ghulam Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Rukshana baji is a 44 year old married woman that has resided in Multan, Pakistan for the past 13 years. Her husband's name is G. S. and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. She is the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. Her oldest daughter helps Rukshana baji make embroidered clothes. The remaining children are enrolled in a local school located near their house. Rukhsana baji makes embroidered dresses to help her husband meet the financial expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy material such as colored thread and cloth for her embroidery business.

Rukshana baji is a group leader of some more women in her locality. Parveen begum baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes for her clothing selling business. Shamim baji is requesting a loan to buy rice to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth de 27 años, vive en su casa propia con su única hija Katia de 6 añitos, comparte la casa con sus hermanas, las cuales la apoyan para que salga adelante. Sin dejarse vencer por la adversidad, Yaneth vende todos los días de manera ambulatoria sus gorritas y sombreros, a lado de su pequeña hija, quien es el motivo principal para todo su sacrificio y es que Yaneth quiere darle unos buenos estudios y una vida digna. A ella le gusta vender sus productos y sobre todo ganar plata y para lograr su meta, no le importa quedarse vendiendo bajo la lluvia, en sus 8 años en este negocio a sabido ganarse la vida y espera que con el tiempo pueda tener un puesto mejor implementado. Lo que más desea es sacar a su hija adelante y darle lo que ella nunca pudo tener. Es el primer préstamo de Yaneth con MFP y espera no fallar en los pagos de sus cuotas, está muy comprometida con su banco comunal y no quiere causarles problemas a las socias que lo integran. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, invertirá todo el monto en incrementar los productos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 27 years old, lives in her own home with her only child, Katia, who is 6. They share the house with Yaneth's sisters, who support her as she tries to improve her life. Not allowing herself to be brought down by adversity, Yaneth sells caps and hats every day as a street vendor alongside her small daughter, who is the reason for all of Yaneth's sacrifices and for whom she wants to secure a good education and a dignified life.

She enjoys selling her products, and above all likes earning money, and to achieve her goal, she doesn't even mind making her sales in the rain. In her 8 years in this business, she has learned how to make a living, she hopes that with time she will be able to have a well-equipped stand to sell her products. What she wants the most is to help her daughter succeed and to give her daughter that which she was never able to have herself.

This is Yaneth's first loan with MFP and she hopes not to miss any of her repayments. She is very much obliged to her community bank and she doesn't want to cause any problems for the members. With the money she seeks, she will buy more merchandise, investing the entire amount in increasing her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Saifiddin

texts.ru: Давлатову Сайфидину 57 лет, он женат. Даже по меркам востока он считается отцом героем – у него 8 детей. Почти все они уже имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно от родителей. Постоянной работы у Сайфиддина нету и поэтому он занимается частным предпринимательством. Его основной ассортимент это строительные материалы. На полученный доход он содержит свою семью. Сайфиддин решил получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса и получить займ.
texts.en:
Saifiddin D. is 57 years old and married. Even by the standards of the East, he is considered a “father-hero” because he has 8 children. Most of them already have their own families and live separately from the parents. Saifiddin does not have a permanent job; this is why he engages in private entrepreneurship. His main goods assortment is construction materials. The profit from the business allows him to support his family. Saifiddin decided to obtain this loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand assortment

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou D. est âgé de 38 ans et  vit avec ses 2 enfants et son épouse dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative  de la république du Mali).
Très tôt, Monsieur Mamadou D.  commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment la réparation de bicyclettes qu’il a appris auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de 10 ans, Monsieur Mamadou D. maîtrise parfaitement son activité.
Pour améliorer son entreprise il décida d’associer la vente des pièces détachées à son activité de  réparation de bicyclettes.
Monsieur Mamadou D. décide  alors d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. 
Il compte utiliser ce deuxième prêt pour acheter un lot important de pièces détachées,les plus demandées lors la réparation des bicyclettes.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue sa vente à Bougouni dans son garage où il répare les bicyclettes. Sa clientèle est composée de propriétaires de bicyclettes et de réparateurs.
Avec ce prêt, Mamadou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA Avec ce bénéfice, il envisage construire une maison, agrandir son entreprise et  subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D., age 38, lives with his two children and wife in a monogamous family in the Hérémakono Nord district of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Early on, he started earning an income, notably in repairing bicycles that he learned how to do from his uncle. With ten years of experience, he has perfectly mastered his business.

To improve his enterprise, he decided to include the sale of spare parts. So he decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his second individual loan. The preceding loan has been correctly repaid.

He intends to use this second loan to buy a major batch of spare parts that are the most in demand when repairing bikes. Supplies are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali), and sales are made in Bougouni in his garage, where he repairs bikes. His customers are composed of bike owners and repairmen.

With this loan, Mamadou intends to realize a monthly of profit of 50,000 francs CFA that he envisions using to build a house, to expand his enterprise, and to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Mahboba Group

texts.en:
Mahboba is the group leader of mahboba group. There are four members in this group. They want to expand their businesses and make them larger.

Mahboba wants take out a loan for her business selling cosmetics. Zaheda wants to take a loan for her son’s business of photography. Farkhanda wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of general store. Also Zahra wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. They have requested a group loan of 30000 Af.

They are all thankful to Kiva lenders for their great support.

loans.use: to enlarge their businesses

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three sons and three daughters, who are all currently in junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to assist her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a carpenter by profession.

Rebecca is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers, food vendors and hawks to sell the rest in her community. Rebecca procures her ingredients from nearby supermarkets. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es casada y madre de cuatro hijos, quienes aun son muy pequeños y requieren de muchas atenciones y cuidados. Desde hace 7 años se hace cargo de la zapatería de su esposo, quien por motivos de trabajo tuvo que dejar. Pero María está realizando un excelente trabajo junto a sus hijas, quienes la apoyan a realizar todos los pedidos que recepcionan en su casa,  ya que su taller funciona en su hogar, facilitando el trabajo. Lo difícil de esta actividad es que demanda mucho tiempo, pero aun así no deja de atender su hogar. Para más adelante, María desea contar con más maquinarias y confeccionar zapatos en mayores cantidades para llevarlos a los mercados del centro de su ciudad o a las provincias donde hay mayor demanda. Ella es una de las fundadoras de su grupo, se encuentra en el treceavo crédito con MFP, y luego de casi 7 años ha mantenido un buen ánimo para trabajar junto a sus compañeras de grupo que han llegado ser como parte de su familia, por las múltiples actividades que realizan dentro del banco comunal. Los 2500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de materiales para confeccionar zapatos, ya  que tiene pedidos por entregar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is married and is the mother of four children, who are still very small and need much attention and care. For the past 7 years she has been in charge of her husband’s shoe shop; her husband had to leave the shop in her care for work-related reasons. María is doing an excellent job together with her daughters, who help her fill all of the orders they receive; she operates a workshop in her home, which makes her work easier. What is most difficult about her work is that it demands much time, but fortunately she doesn’t have to leave to attend to her home. In the future María would like to have more machines and make shoes in larger quantities so she can take them to the markets in the central part of the city or to the provinces, where there is much demand. She is one of the founders of her communal bank; this is her thirteenth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and after almost 7 years she remains enthusiastic about working with the other members of her bank. María’s group has become like part of her family due to the numerous activities that they participate in together within their communal bank. The 2500 soles that María is asking for will be invested in the purchase of materials for making shoes, since she has orders that she needs to deliver to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials for her shoe shop

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme est célibataire, devant subvenir à ses propres charges, elle a appris le métier de la cuisine et  a ouvert son propre restaurant, elle sert à ses clients de la spécialité togolaise comme la pâte, du fufu. Ses plats sont très appréciés. Les produits de première nécessité pour l’activité de la restauration étant épuisés, elle  sollicite son premier crédit qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner avec 4 sacs de riz, 1 sacs de charbons, 7 boîtes de tomates, 1 bidon de 25l et divers.
texts.en:
This is a young woman who is unmarried. Having to support herself, she learned to cook as a trade and opened her own restaurant. She serves her customers Togolese specialties, such as pâte and fufu. Her dishes are greatly appreciated. Since the necessary ingredients for her restaurant business are out of stock, she's requesting her first loan that will enable her to resupply herself with four sacks of rice, a sack of charcoal, seven cans of tomatoes, a 24-liter drum of cooking oil, and various other items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, charcoal, canned tomatoes, a drum of oil, etc.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Nelly es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Nelly tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Nelly son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Communal Bank Llapanchik, which means All Together in Quechua. Nelly lives with her partner, is 37 years old, and has 1 child. Nelly has a small neighborhood store in her house where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and fruits; she carries out this activity every day with the help of her husband. Nelly needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Nelly dreams are that her children become professional, and to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mrs. Samnang Hong Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people living I. Tareap Doun village I. Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Samnang H. is the 40 year old village bank president. She sells fish which her husband, Mr. Ho Saroeun, fishes from the lake. Although they try to work hard, they don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Samnang H. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets to help her husband’s fishing. This couple has five children, four of whom are enrolled I. the local school while the youngest oN. is too young to work or study. Mrs. Sun C. could not be present for the picture, so her husband is shown I. the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets to help her husband’s fishing.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza E. is from the town of Aloran. She is 38 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Liza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khanh's Group

texts.en:
Khánh Thị Nguyễn was born in 1966. ( id number: 010102120006). She lives in Xom Vang, Co Loa, Dong Anh Ha Noi with her husband and two son. Her husband is a breakdown mechanic. Her two son are workers. And Khanh’s main job is farming. They have a monthly income of about 5.000.000 vnd. She is a group leader of five- member group. This time, she wants to borrow 5.014.000 vnd(or 300 USD) to buy bike parts .
 About the other borrower in her group.
 Hiền Thị Nguyễn Was born in 1974. ( ID number: 010102120010). She has 2 children. She is a worker. Beside, she sells fruits in the market. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND( or 245 USD) to sell fruits in the market. 
 Hậu Thị Nguyễn was born in 1963. ( id number: 010102120008). She has 2 children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 vnd( or 300 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.
 Gắn Thị Hoàng was born in 1953. ( id number: 010102120013). She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5.015.000 vnd ( or 300 USD) to buy more clothes.
 Đại Thị Trần was born in 1957. ( id number: 010102120007).  Her main job is farming. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 vnd ( or 300  USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy bike parts

loans.name: Asoiva

texts.en:
Asoiva F. is a 31-year-old woman living in the town of Matautu Uta Lefaga.  She is married and has five school-aged children.  The main source of income from her crop-raising business comes from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Asoiva has been engaged in this business for over three years.

Asoiva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Asoiva has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.  Asoiva is now requesting a new loan of $375 which will be used to purchase more harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Asoiva plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells drinks, provisons and foodstuffs. She is from Okada in Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase a refrigerator for cooling her drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerator and drinks

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en:
Odsuren D. is married and lives with his two children in Arhangai province, one of the central provinces of Mongolia. His two sons are both high school students.

Odsuren sells various clothes for women and men. He rents a small stall in the local market called Hasu Center and sells the clothes at his stall. He mostly purchases clothes for his business from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Since the start in 2007, he has been in the clothing retail business and, within two years, his business capital has increased from 200,000 MNT to 600,000 MNT (1 USD = 1,450 MNT).

Odsuren requests a loan to purchase more clothes for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: María Pilar

texts.es: María Pilar L. reside en Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador. María tiene 58 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos mayores de edad quienes se encuentran trabajando. María se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde su casa, tiene diez años de experiencia dedicándose a lo mismo lo que hoy le permite ser muy conocida en la zona y tener una clientela frecuente, María ya ha manejado créditos anteriormente y ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas, ella ahora solicita de este crédito para comprar maíz y leña para la producción de tortillas.
texts.en:
. María Pilar lives in Soyapango in the San Salvador department. She is 58 years old and lives with her husband and her two eldest sons who are adult and employed. María sells tortillas from her home and has 10 years of experience in this line of work which makes her very well-known in her area; she has many regular customers. María has managed loans previously and has been very punctual with her repayments. She asks for this loan to buy corn and firewood needed to make tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn and firewood for tortilla production.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga S. is 50 years old. She is married to Mr. Byron S. and they are blessed with five children. Despite their economic situation, they aim to give their children a better future by providing the best education possible. They have helped each other earn a living and finance the education of their children. As a result, two of the children have finished a vocational course, while the others are still studying.

Farming is the common source of their living; they plant rice and vegetables twice a year. Aside from this, Dominga is engaged in rice retailing to earn additional income since harvesting takes a long time. She wants to sell more rice, but she has inadequate capital to do so.  

She would like to borrow 9,000 PHP to acquire more rice to be sold in their village since it is one of the basic commodities. She hopes that she can improve her small business and continue to support the schooling of their children.

loans.use: additional capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Agvaandorj

texts.en:
Agvaandorj A. is 24 years old and lives with his wife and two infant children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. His oldest child, age three, is in kindergarten and his youngest is only one year old. His wife currently works as a salesperson and has a monthly salary of 120,000 tugrugs (~84 USD). A. operates a wooden product making business in his town. He started his business in 2007, with capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs (~700 USD). 

Before starting his business, A. previously helped his mother run her grocery shop and learned much about how to operate a business. A. is very hardworking and always looks for ways to grow his business. In addition to making wood products, he also purchases manufactured products from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to sell. For the future, A. plans to have his own workshop to make his products. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~490 USD) loan to purchase wood and other materials used to make his products. 

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase wood and other materials used to make his products

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.es: El señor Daniel P. , es un hombre agricultor desde hace mas de 40 años , gracias al apoyo de sus padres y esposa que le brindaron un terreno para que lo trabaje , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son los problemas de plagas ya que los cultivos carecen de fertilizantes e insumos y esto provoco muchas perdidas , ahora quiere darle el mantenimiento adecuado para poder tener un mejor producto , con el préstamo va a comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para inducir , don Daniel habita en el barrio San Pedro , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa ella era de gran ayuda para él por que todo lo que sacaba de producto lo comercializaba , ahora ya no cuenta con este apoyo debido a la enfermedad de diabetes que sufre hace seis meses , hasta lograr perder tres dedos de su pies izquierdo , con el apoyo que cuenta es con su hija mayor que esta a cargo de todas las actividades del hogar. Ellos son tres hermanos todos independientes. Pero son una familia unida. Contenta con el financiamiento que la institución ha dado para mejorar su cultivo de pitahaya
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel P. has been a farmer for more than 40 years, thanks to the support of his parents and wife who provided him with a plot of land to work. The greatest difficulty presented to him is the problem of plagues, since the crops lack fertilizers and other materials, which causes great losses. Now he wants to give them adequate care to be able to have better products. With this loan he is going to buy the necessary fertilizers to achieve this goal. Daniel lives with his wife in the neighborhood San Pedro, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She was a great help to him, because everything he produced she would market. However, he no longer has this support, because she has been suffering from diabetes for six months, even losing three toes from left foot. He now counts on the support of his oldest daughter, who is in charge of all of the domestic chores. Although they are very independent, they are a united family and are content with the financing that this institution has given them to improve their cultivation of dragon fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to improve the cultivation of dragon fruit

loans.name: Badenya  (Kinship) Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Badenya de l’association Jekafo sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge des femmes du groupe se situe autour de 25 ans  et elles ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Les membres du groupe Badenya vivent dans des familles traditionnelles à Yangasso préfecture de San (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté.
L’activité principale de ces femmes est l’achat et la vente d’arachide, de haricot et d’habits. Elles sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, le groupe Badenya a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 62 sacs d’arachide, 20 sacs de haricot et  des colis d’habits pour enfants et femmes. 
Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des producteurs et effectuent leurs ventes, au comptant en détail à la maison et au marché de Yangasso. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 62.700 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. 
NB : Sur la photo elles sont au nombre de 5 parce que la sixième  du nom de Awa C. était allée à l’hôpital avec un de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Badenya in the association Jekafo are all married. The average age of the women is about 25 years old and they each have an average of 3 children. The members of the group Badenya live in traditional families in the town of Yangasso, in the prefecture of San (region of Ségou, Republic of Mali). The know one another through the neighborhood and through familial relationships. Their main business is to purchase and re-sell peanuts, beans and clothes. They are highly sought-out for their businesses. In order to satisfy the needs of their clientele and to grow their clientele, the group Badenya decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their third group loan. All of their previous loans were correctly repaid. They will use this loan to purchase 62 sacks of peanuts, 20 sacks of beans and sets of clothes for women and children. They supply themselves directly from the producers and sell their goods for cash at retail prices from their homes and also from the market of Yangasso. They hope to earn an average monthly profit of 62,700 FCFA, which they will use to pay the interest on their loans, cover the expenses for their families' needs and they will invest the rest in their businesses. Please note: In the photo their are only 5 women, as the sixth member of the group (called Awa C.) had gone to the hospital with one of her children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase peanuts, beans and clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Kahengye Group, Rukungiri

texts.en: A. Innocent is the leader of her lending group in Rukungiri. She is a married lady with four children, two in secondary school and two in primary school. She also takes care of 2 dependents. Innocent has had a grocery business in Kahengye Trading centre for 10 years. Her customers are local people and she says that she is faced with a low market for her goods. Innocent says that she is able to make 80,000 UGX/ a week as profits. Her goal is to enlarge her business so that she is able to serve Rukungiri town. This would allow her to continue saving more towards educating her children to the University level. She needs a loan to buy more vegetables and fresh fruits for her business and this will help her pay her children’s school fees with much ease. Innocent is such a determined lady.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fresh fruits for resale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer amante de las caminatas, considera que es bueno para la salud. Ella tiene 49 años y está separada del padre de sus hijos. Actualmente vive con su hija Karen de 28 años.
Cada día se levanta muy temprano para cocinar los alimentos de su hogar, ya que a las 9 de la mañana empieza su labor como enfermera de un centro de salud, donde labora por horas. 
A partir de las 5 de la tarde recorre la calles de su barrio con su catalogo en mano para mostrar las ofertas de cosméticos.
En esta actividad tiene cerca de un año y le gusta muchísimo porque conoce gente con la que conversa y entabla amistades duraderas. A veces se siente cansada por las caminatas, pero debe hacerlo; no sólo por su trabajo, sino también por salud. 
Margarita anhela con el tiempo comprarse vitrinas donde pueda organizar todo su stock de cosméticos, pues así se verán mucho más atractivos.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está segura de ser cumplida con sus pagos, como lo fue con sus anteriores préstamos, ya que sabe que en los negocios es muy importante el apoyo de un crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de más productos, para que pueda vender no sólo mostrando el catalogo, sino también con el producto en las manos.
texts.en:
Margarita is a woman who loves walking, she considers it good for the health. She is 49 and is separated from the father of her children. Currently she lives with her daughter Karen who is 28. She gets up very early every day to cook the food for the house, as at nine in the morning she begins her work as a nurse at a health centre, where she works for hours. From 5 in the afternoon she travels the streets of her suburb with her catalogue in hand to show her cosmetic offers. She has done this for close to a year and likes it a lot because she can meet people who she can talk with and strike up lasting friendships. Sometimes she feels tired with all the walking, but she must do it; not only for her work, but also for her health. Margarita longs for the time she can buy display cabinets where she can organize all her cosmetic stock, then they will be a lot more appealing. This is her third loan with MFP and she is confident of fulfilling her payments, as was the case with her previous loans, since she knows that in business the support from a loan is very important. The money that she is asking for now is for the purchase of more products, so that she can sell not just by showing the catalogue, but also with the product in the hand.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Roca Fuerte es una asociación que desea un crédito para su primer ciclo, en el centro focal de Villa Exaltación. Los negocios de las socias son diferentes, desde artesanías, confección de faldas, confección de chamarras, venta de zapatos deportivos, muebles, abarrotes, venta de comida, costura de buzos y mantas. 

Una de las socias màs antiguas es la señora Mery M., con 9 ciclos en la asociación, su negocio es la confección de chamarras.  Los materiales son comprados por mayor en la ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto.  Las chamarras son elaboradas en el mismo domicilio, su esposo es un apoyo. Las ventas son realizadas en su mismo hogar, pues sus clientes vienen a recoger la mercadería al mismo.  Le gusta las reuniones de pago en el centro focal pues es un momento de esparcimiento y le permite descansar.
texts.en:
The community association Roca Fuerte ("Strong Rock") wants a loan for their first cycle in the focal center of Villa Exaltación. The women's businesses are all different, from artisanry, making skirts and jackets, selling sports shoes, furniture, groceries, food sales, and sewing sweaters and blankets. One of the oldest businesswomen is Mrs. Mery M.. She has gone through nine loan cycles with the association with her business making jackets. The materials are born in bulk in the city of El Alto. Mery makes the jackets in her home with her husband's support. She sells the jackets from her own home, so the customers come and retrieve the merchandise themselves. Mery likes meetings in the center because it is a leisure activity that allows her to relax.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric, zippers, thread and snaps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: God Is In Control Group

texts.en:
Helena G. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Is In Control. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children, aged 5 and 11 years old. She did not continue her education through 11th grade.
For 5 years, Helena has been selling cosmetics such as soap and body cream at the Smell No Taste Market in Harbel, Liberia. She sells good quality products, which keeps customers returning. 
She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more body cream and soaps. Her goal is to grow her business to a bigger store and to give her children a higher education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Helena is the one holding the sign.  Mamie C. is inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more body cream and soaps.

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en: Dorjpalam is 45 years-old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house which they built themselves. During the day, he operates a consumer goods trading business in his town.  He has been operating his business since 2004, and has steadily expanded it. In 2004, his working capital was 1,000,000 tugrugs (~ 705 USD), and with his business profits Dorjpalam built a house for his family .  His wife, Bulgantamir, sells goods at the Terh trading center. With the experience they gained in previous years, they are knowledgeable about their product prices and selection, and have a loyal customer base. Dorjpalam is a very hardworking person. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1407 USD) loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Antonio De La Cruz

texts.es:
El señor Antonio de la Cruz A. V. es casado tiene tres hijos menores en edada escolar habita en el reparto francisco palavicine. trabaja en la alcaldía municipal desde hace diez años como operario de limpieza pública
El señor Antonio de la Cruz A. V. ha cancelado cinco créditos demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en lo que a obligación respecta, todos estos crédito los ha utilizado para ayudarse ha mantener estables su familia y mejorar su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Antonio de la Cruz A. V. is married and has three, school-aged children; he lives in the Francisco Palavicine neighborhood and has been a municipal employee for 10 years. Antonio de la Cruz A. V. has repaid five previous loans in a timely fashion. He used all the loans to help himself maintain his family stability and to make some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for the family.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 23 years old and married with two children, ages 4 years and 8 months. Her eldest is already attending school. She is a farmer in western Kenya near Kitale town. She has been practicing mixed farming for four years, producing maize, nappier grass (animal feeds), potatoes, and sugarcane. She sells her produce to the local market. She also earns income from the sale of livestock, like cows, sheep and goats.

She requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income she earns from this loan will help her develop her farm and educate her children. Her main challenge is the unpredictable weather patterns and high cost of production. In future, she wants to acquire a well-established farm by expanding from the current 2.75 acres to 10 acres.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Victor Avelino

texts.es:
Víctor de 62 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, hace unos años atrás el tenia una avícola( lugar donde vende todo tipo de carnes) con ese negocio mantenía a su familia. Pero cuando sus hijas crecieron el decidió dejarles la avícola a ellas, y compro víveres para tener su propia tienda. 

Ahora Víctor trabaja en su tienda desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00pm todos los días, vende todo tipo de víveres, en ocasiones vende al por mayor sus productos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceites, azúcar y arroz para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victor is 62 years old. He lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil. For a long time he had a meat market (a place where he sold all types of meat). He supported his family with this business. When his daughters grew up, he decided to give the meat market to them and buy supplies of food in order to have his own grocery store. Now Victor works in his store from 7:00am until 10:00pm everyday. He sells all types of groceries. Sometimes he sells his products at a wholesale level. With this loan he would like to buy oil, sugar and rice for his store. In the future he would like to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Oil, sugar, rice

loans.name: Marlene Sabina

texts.es: Marlene Sabina tiene 29 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado y destace de carne. Tiene más de 5 años tener este negocio, se dedica principalmente a la crianza y venta de animales .Estas actividades le ayudan a solventar la economía familiar ya que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo. Marlene desea comprar alimento balanceado para mejorar la calidad de sus animales también le gustaría mejorar la estructura de su vivienda ya que el invierno se acerca y quiere preparada. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ganado ya que este negocio es muy rentable.
texts.en:
Marlene Sabina is 29 years old. Her business is the purchase and sale of livestock and butchering. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. She works mainly in raising and selling animals. These activities help her pay the family bills, since she has two young children who are in her care. Marlene wants to buy balanced feed to improve the quality of her animals. She also would like to improve the structure of her house since winter is coming and she wants to be prepared. The loan that she is applying for is to buy livestock, since this business is very profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: David Agustin

texts.es:
David de 22 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (su originalidad fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil, cuando se gradúo del colegio no encontró trabajo y su papa le empezó a enseñar como hacer panes.     

Después que el aprendió ha hacer panes el invirtió sus ahorros en un horno y empezó a venderlos, por esa buena decisión el ahora el tiene una pequeña panadería en su casa, trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Cada pan lo vende a $ 0.10. 

Para una mejor atención a sus clientes el quiere dar desayunos y comprar con el préstamo una licuadora y sacos de harina para hacer mas pan. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener su panadería mas surtida.
texts.en:
David, 22, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (it used to be a field where many orchids grew), Guayaquil. When he graduated from high school he didn’t find a job so his father taught him how to bake bread. When he learned how to bake he used his savings to buy an oven and started selling bread. This good decision has led to his having a small bakery in his home. He works from 6:30am until 9pm every day; he sells each roll for $0.10. To provide better customer service, he wants to start selling breakfast and wants to use the loan to buy a blender and sacks of flour for more bread. In the future, he wants to finish building his house and have a better stocked bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a mixer and flour.

loans.name: Abed El Aziz

texts.en:
Abed El Aziz is a 26-year-old single man living in Lebanon. Since 2004, he has been working in construction. This type of business is very common in Lebanon. 

Abed El Aziz is known for his good work and is proud of his experience. He is able to serve several clients at the same time. His clients are people from his region and its surroundings. 

He is requesting for the first time a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He plans to purchase a cement blender machine for his work. He hopes to continue to grow and enhance his business in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase a cement blender machine

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen S., 32, is widowed and resides with her three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known as the most favorite tourist place in the country. S. sells prepared food, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase utensils to start a business of selling food. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the studies of her children. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy utensils to start a business of selling food.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna P. lives in Hatsavan village of Syunik marz in Armenia. Together, with her husband and two children, Susanna and her family are occupied in breeding cattle and in land cultivation. Susanna is a very enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s condition. This loan will help her buy some livestock.

loans.use: For buying livestock.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou O., 64, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She has been selling clothes since 2006 and is able to make about US $6 per day. Her husband, pictured here, is too old and stays at home. This family is supported by one child’s income of US $5 each day. Her child sells cosmetic products. Sou O. would like to take out a loan of US $900 for her child to expand her cosmetics store.

loans.use: To expand her cosmetics store

loans.name: Mwaboya

texts.en: Mwaboya is a married woman with one child who is in school. Her husband is a chef, by profession. She owns a shop and operates public van (matatus) as her other source of income. She has been operating her business as a shopkeeper for five years. Her other source of income is earned from operating a vehicle business. With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cereals, beans, maize and rice. Her major challenges are seasonality and high competition, as a result of lots of motor vehicle operators. She hopes to own a van  company in the future. Her major reason for joining Yehu is because of its good reputation. Mwaboya owns a home with electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is electricity.

loans.use: To purchase cerals, beans, maize and rice.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Carmen de 25 años de edad es casada, trabaja para el INRUT desde hace 4 años, desempeñandose como contadora. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir el año e inodoro de su casa para contar con mayor comodidad en su hogar, ya que como esta esperando su primer bebè desea esperarlo con las mejores condiciones posibles.  

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su bebè las comodidades necesarias para que crezca en un ambiente sano y agradable.
texts.en:
Carmen is 25 years old. She is married and has worked for INRUT for the past 4 years, as an accountant. She is seeking her first loan, with the aim of building a bathroom and toilet in her house, to increase the comfort of her home. She is expecting her first baby and would like to have the best possible living conditions. Her greatest dream is to be able to offer her baby everything it will need to grow in a clean and pleasant environment.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom and toilet

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda, de 28 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Teófilo de 32 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Hilda ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papa y maíz, las cuales lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea alquilar un puesto en el mercado mayorista, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores oportunidades y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hilda, 28, is a very hard working mother.  She lives in a rented house with her husband, Teófilo, 32, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better future.

With much effort Hilda has been managing to make her fields more productive.  She grows potato and corn which she then sells in Tarma’s wholesale market where she sells them at wholesale.

Her crops have provided income necessary to support her family.  This is why she wants to continue to put everything into having her business succeed.

What she likes best about her work is caring for the crops.  She has been a farmer for 9 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport the products all the way to Tarma because the sacks she carries are very heavy and they tire her out.  In the future she’d like to lease a stand in the wholesale market in order to improve her income.

This is her 8th loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual with her previous loans and is always aware of her group’s decisions.

She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more manure that she expects will improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane Y. is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell.  Jane is 40 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to support the family by providing necessary materials at home.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell
