loans.name: Mrs. Naut Sokea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who live in Kouk Pring village in Kandal province are requesting a village bank loan. Mrs. Naut S., 31 years old, is the village bank president and has been selected as the group leader. Each group member will uS. his or her portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Naut S. is a dessert seller in her local village where she is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bet Man, is a construction worker. They have four children all of whom attend school and help with their parents’ businesses. Currently, Mrs. Naut S.'s home is messy becauS. there is no lavatory to uS.. To improve her family’s standard of living, Mrs. Naut S. will uS. this loan to build a lavatory in her home.

loans.use: to build a lavatory

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann A. is from the town of Banga. She is 31 years old. Mary Ann is married and has a 14-year-old child. 
To make a living, she plants and harvests rice crop and vegetables. She sells her harvest to the market and it helps her provide for her family. Aside from the farm, she also grows pigs for fattening. She says it helps to have another source of income.

Mary Ann joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and feeds for the pigs. This loan will be the Mary Ann's first loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Jose Abelardo

texts.es: El Señor Abelardo es un hombre muy dedicado a su hogar y su familia, el es pensionado desde hace varios años, tiene 55 años, pero siempre esta al pendiente de las necesidades de su casa, El y su esposa solicitan este credito para reparar la puerta trasera de su vivienda, ya que es corrediza y por causa de las lluvias y de los años, la puerta esta muy oxidada y deteriorada.
texts.en: Abelardo is a man who is very dedicated to his home and his family.  He has been on pension for several years and is 55 years.  However, he is always attentive to the household needs.  He and his wife are requesting this loan to repair the back door to their house since it is a sliding door and is very rusty and damaged due to the rain and its age.

loans.use: To repair the back door of the house

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Mrs. Helen M. is from the Barangay of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married and blessed with four children, all of whom are now adults. To make a living, she is presently engaged in ready-to-wear (RTW) and direct selling business. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for two years already. Currently she is earning at least 8,000 PHP per month from the sales of her business. 

Just this year, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP as her first loan availment, which will be used for additional capital for her existing RTW and direct selling business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her RTW and direct selling business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita H. lives in Kapan city. One of her daughters is married and lives separately from her mother, and another daughter is a student in Yerevan. 

Five years ago Margarita organized her own business in a rented shop, and now she runs a gift shop and photographic studio at the same place. Her daughter's husband helps Margarita at her business, so part of the business income goes to her daughter's young family. 

She and her son-in-law take pictures and develop photographic films by themselves, and at the gift shop Margarita sells toys, pictures, clocks, statuettes, photo albums, frames and so on. With her son-in-law's help Margarita buys merchandise from Yerevan once a month. 

Margarita is asking for a 750,000 AMD loan to increase her gift shop assortment and to buy photographic paper, cartridges, etc. for her photographic studio. This is her 4th loan from Nor Horizon, and she has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: To increase her gift shop assortment and to buy photographic paper, cartridges, etc. for her photographic studio

loans.name: Fanny Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Fanny T. G. es trabajadora en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua (UNAN), desde hace 17 años. 
Esta señora tiene 37 años de edad, es acompañada con dos hijos a cargo en edad escolar.
Es el tercer crédito que trabaja en CEPRODEL, el cual lo utilizara para construcción de vivienda. Agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle estos créditos ya que le ayudan a mejorar su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fanny Tellez Gaitan has been an employee of the university "Nacional Autonoma (UNAN)" in Nicaragua for the past 17 years.

She is 37 years old and she has 2 school-aged children in her care. 

This is her third loan through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and it will be used to build a house. She is grateful to Ceprodel for granting her these loans. They have helped her improve her quality of life, and that of her children.

loans.use: To carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Passy

texts.en: Passy is a 39-year-old single mother of two children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Passy has been selling secondhand clothes for twelve years. She started out with capital of 100,000 UGX and she now has capital of 1,500,000 UGX. Her hardship is too much sunshine and her vision is to have a wholesale business and to build a house. Passy needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: buying secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Koem's Group

texts.en:
Twelve members have formed a village bank loan   They are located in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Koem Chhen, born in 1962, is the village bank leader. She was selected to be the village bank leader by the other members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Choy John, are farmers who own a  1.50-hectare plot of land.  They use it to cultivate rice and corn to support their family.  In order to support this farming, Mrs. Koem C. would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, gasoline and corn seeds , and to pay for hired laborers for growing crops. 

This couple has four children.   One is a laborer.   The others are students and also support their parents'  farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, gasoline and corn seeds, and to pay for hired laborers for growing crops.

loans.name: Riamet

texts.en:
Riamet M.  is 24 years old, single, and a hard-working man. He supports his mother and his six siblings.

Riamet is a livestock trader: he buys the cattle,  rears them,  and sells them later at a profit in Narok town. He has done this  for the last four years and earns a good income.  

He learned about KADET LTD from KADET staff. He is applying for his second loan, with which he intends to more animals for resale. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standards of his family and for business expansion.

Riamet's dream is to prosper in the business of livestock trading.

loans.use: to buy more animals for resale

loans.name: Patrick Mariga

texts.en:
Patrick Mariga O. is a 28-years-old single man from Bamburi; Mombasa. He is a poultry farmer. Patrick has been running his poultry business for the last five years and the business is doing well with good income. 

This marks his second loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to buy medicine and feed for his poultry. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his business. His dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy medicine and feed for his poultry.

loans.name: 050422 - Trung Trieu - Hoang Phong Group

texts.en:
"Hoa L. T. (1) is a 60 year-old femaL. living in the town of H. hoa - Thanh hoa.  Hoa is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 050422 - Trung Trieu - H. Phong (050422 - Trung Trieu - H. Phong).


Hoa is married and has 2 adult children.  Hoa operates a family member's specialized retail store selling internet connection & services.  Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Manh L. T. (4) is a 47 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Them L. T. (26) is a 44 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Giang H. T. (27) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Tham L. T. (2) is a 35 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Hao L. T. (3) is a 40 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa L. T. (1) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố H. hoa - Thanh hoa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 050422 - Trung Trieu - H. Phong (050422 - Trung Trieu - H. Phong).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các dịch vụ kết nối internet trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Manh L. T. (4) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Them L. T. (26) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Giang H. T. (27) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Tham L. T. (2) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Hao L. T. (3) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santos Angela

texts.es:
Santos tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Manuel Seoane que está ubicado a 20 km D. la zona rural D. la localidad D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza D. ganado ovino y D. cerdos, los cuales cría en un  ambiente cercano a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad se encargan D. sacar adelante a su familia. Esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 5 años por ello cuenta con clientela fidelizada.

Santos desea comprar  alimento balanceado para su ganado D. modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas permitiéndole vender a un buen precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santos is 52 years old.  She is married and lives together with her husband and son in the village of Manuel Seoane which is located 20km from the rural area of TambogranD., an agricultural district in Piura region which is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Santos' business is raising sheep and pigs.  She raises her animals near her home and when they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the general public and the traders who usually visit her area.  She uses the income from her business to get her family ahead in life.  She has been in this business for five years and has a loyal customer base.

Santos would like to buy balanced feed for her animals so that she can increase her sales and sell her animals for a good price.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zahira

texts.en:
Zahira is a 39-year-old mother, married to Abd Al Hamid, a taxi driver. She has two young sons.

Zahira started her home-business a year ago selling cosmetics and Dead Sea products at her house to help her husband with the family income. 

 Now she has applied for a loan to vary the products she sells, by adding other kinds of cosmetics and other brands.

loans.use: To add variety in the products she sells.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris, 41 years old, is married to Peter and they have five school-going children. Peris has been selling different types of used clothing in Ndunyu Njeru for the last nine years.

Peris was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of her friends and this will be her third loan. She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. Peris plans to use the loan amount to buy more bedsheets to sell as her stock is running out. In the future, Peris hopes to grow her business and move into a more permanent place.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta  is 49 years of age and married with eight children. Mareta owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting breadfruit for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Mareta needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase farming supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 290 talas or US $121 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Mareta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mareta's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrelita is from Cabiriuan Gonzaga, Cagayan.  She has run a general store for five years, earning the average net income of PHP3,000 each month.  In the store, Estrelita even sells fish. Her business income is invested in livestock raising and some is saved for future use. 

She is 42 years old and is married to a farmer. As of this moment, Estrelita has no child, but is praying for one soon. In the future, Estrelita dreams of better living standards.  She is requesting a loan amount of PHP8,000 to purchase groceries, such as soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, such soft drinks

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of three borrowers shown in the picture. The group leader, Mrs. Sao is 53 years old. She sells rice soup and Khmer cakes in a small kiosk next to her house, and earns an average of US$ 2.50 profit per day. In addition, for years she has been planting rice crop on her  farmland. Mrs. Sao is a widow and a mother of six kids. Three of them are single and the other three are married.  Two of them work as a driver and at the garment factory.  Mrs. Sao relies on their income to help with the family expense. Mrs. Sao would like a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her rice crop. This will provide her with additional income to meet her family’s needs and provide more financial stability. 

The two other borrowers are:
Mr. Seur who is asking for a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer for her crop.
Mrs. Khie, is a domestic rice farmer and fish seller, who is applying for a loan to pay for plowing cost.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 52 years old and married with four children. Erma works very hard to provide for them.

Erma runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like noodles and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Erma has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Erma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like noodles and groceries to sell

loans.name: Mariana

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Bela-Vista, é solteira, de 28 anos de idade, reside em Bela-Vista, tem nível Básico, tem um filho, de 8 anos e Frequenta a 3ª.classe, tem a sua mãe à sua responsabilidade.

É docente há dois anos, trabalha na EPC - Bela-Vista, tem um salário de  4.200.00mt, com o salário compra alimentos para a família, paga outras despesas e não faz poupança.

Nunca teve créditos com outros bancos, conhece a Hluvuku desde a sua criação, o primeiro empréstimo foi de 3.000.00mt para a reparação da geleira, o segundo de 6.000.00mt para a compra de cimento e areia, o actual é de 20.000.00mt destinado a compra de material de construção (blocos, pedra e cimento).

Sonha e concluir a construção da casa da mãe e mobilá-la, e conta com o apoio da Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Mariana was born in Bela-Vista, is single, 28 years old, lives in Bela-Vista and has a basic level of education. She has an 8 year old son who’s in 3rd grade and she also supports her mother.

She has been a teacher for 2 years and works in EPC – Bela-Vista, earning 4,200 meticals (MZN). With her salary she buys food for her family, pays for other expenses and does not save money.

She has never had loans with other banks and has known Hluvuku since its inception. Her first loan was for 3,000 MZN to fix her refrigerator, the second was for 6,000 MZN to purchase cement and sand and the current loan is for 20,000 MZN, destined for the purchase of construction materials (blocks, stone and cement).

She dreams of completing the build of her mother’s house and of furnishing it. She counts on Hluvuku’s support.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (blocks, stone and cement)

loans.name: Amigas De Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE FE Y ALEGRIA” iniciará el ciclo número cuatro en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Ilaria.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescado, brosteria, venta de panza, venta de poleras, producción de colchones.
 
La señora Ilaria indica que es el tercer ciclo que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de brosteria, que viene trabajando hace una año atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne de gallina) los que compra de la distribuidora y lo venderá en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
The “AMIGAS DE FE Y ALEGRIA” [Friends of Faith and Happiness] community association will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Germán Busch center. It is made up of eight members. The community association is led by a board of directors and the head is Ilaria. The community association members' businesses are varied. Among them, we have: selling fish, roasted chicken, tripe, t-shirts, and making mattresses.  
 
Ilaria indicates that this is the third cycle that she has been a member of the community association in Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a developer. At present she has a business selling roasted chicken, which she has done for a year.  

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy chicken. She will buy it at a distributor and sell it at her store. This work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. She is in a common law marriage with three children.

loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Akashi

texts.en:
Akashi is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business, doing a manicure business, and operating from the shop and from home. She faces major challenges of competition and of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a big beauty salon business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000, she wants to purchase pedicure sets, manicure sets and lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase pedicure sets, manicure sets and lotions.

loans.name: Duo Solidario Vicion De Fe Group

texts.es: Elica, D. 38 años y tiene 4 hijos ella se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales y tambien se dedica a la venta D. cosmeticos, ella nos cuenta que le a gustado mucho su negocio porque le gustan mucho los animales ella compra los animales pequeños y ya cuando estan grandes los venD. asi le queda un poco D. ganancia y en los ratos libres venD. cosmeticos,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. animales y compra D. cosmeticos,al igual que la siguiente socia que se dedica a la venta D. tortilleria, el sueño D. ellas es darles lo mejor a sus hijos y que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Elica is 38 years old and has four children. She breeds and sells animals, and she also sells cosmetics. She says that she likes her business a lot because she likes the animals. She buys small animals and when they are big she sells them, getting a little profit, and in her free time she sells cosmetics. She is asking for this loan to buy animals and cosmetics. Like another member who sells tortillas, these women’s dream is to give their children the best and to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy and sell animals and cosmetics.

loans.name: Leibert Isidro

texts.es:
Leibert Isidro tiene 32 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

 La VRC Unión y Progreso la Colombia baja, esta conformada por quince integrantes y está ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa esta ventanilla se dedica a Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, Soya plátano, naranja, etc. 

Leibert se dedica a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de cacao arroz, maíz, soya, plátano, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos e insumos agrícolas para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos. 
Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudará a suplir necesidades económicas, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas. 
El sueño es poderse comprar más hectáreas e terreno para aumentar la siembra y poder incrementar los ingresos. 
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el bolibol.
texts.en:
Leibert Isidro is 32 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  He lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'Unión y Progreso la Colombia Baja' community bank has fifteen members and is located 90 minutes from our cooperative.  The members of this bank work in agriculture, growing cacao, rice, corn, soy, bananas, oranges, etc.

Leibert is a farmer who grows cacao, rice, corn, soy and bananas.  He makes both his purchases and sales in San José del Tambo every weekend.

Leibert is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure and agricultural supplies to keep his crops in good condition.

The support of this loan will help Leibert to financially cover his needs.  He faces very frequent challenges such as competition and pests.

Leibert's dream is to buy more hectares of land so that he can increase the amount of crops he grows and also his income.  In his free time, he enjoys taking part in sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and agricultural supplies to keep his crops in good condition

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with two school going children. Her husband is a taxi driver who also contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a vegetable grocery business for the past five years, in addition she also sells charcoal. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transport from the market to the business. She dreams of owning a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions for sale. She decided to join Yehu to have access to loans.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 40 years old and a married woman with seven children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling dried fish in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. Charity requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 29 years old and is a married woman with 3 children aged 6, 3 and 2. She sells baskets and other products made of bamboo. She has been running this business for 5 years. Marites earns about 3,000 PHP per month. Marites also raises pigs in her backyard. She plans to use her loan to buy more bamboos, bolo (a large Filipino cutting tool similar to the machete) and piglets to raise. Marites hopes to have a stable income to help support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more bamboos, bolo (cutting tool) and piglets to raise

loans.name: Petita Beatriz

texts.es:
Petita de 55 años, vive en una suburbana llamada “Durán”.
La actividad de ella es una pequeña librería que está ubicado en la parte delantera de su vivienda.
Escogió esta actividad porque le gusta el comercio y la compra y venta de mercadería.
Su horario es de lunes a domingo, desde las 7:00am hasta las 22:00pm.
Está casada, su esposo es jubilado y tiene tres hijas, ya todas son mayores de edad.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como cuaderno, plumas, marcadores, etc.
Su sueño es que su negocio aumente en mercadería y que incremente sus ventas.
texts.en: Petita is 55 years old and lives in a suburban area called 'Durán'.  Her business is a small stationery store which is located in the front part of her home.  She chose this business because she likes commerce and buying and selling merchandise.  She works from Monday to Sunday, from 7.00am to 10.00pm.  Petita is married, her husband is retired, and she has three daughters who are all adults.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as composition books, pens, markers, etc.  Her dream is to have more merchandise for her business and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as composition books, pens, markers, etc.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en: Shaira is 55 years old, married and has two sons and one daughter.  To make a living, Shaira raises livestock. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 250 AZN a month. She applied for a loan in amount of 1200 AZN to buy feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals.

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en: Arevhat lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Pokr Mantash.  She is married and has a 32-year-old son.  She considers herself a hardworking and honest person and has been able to run the family farm for the past 20 years.  In addition to supporting her family, she helps relatives nearby with produce grown on the farm.  Arevhat would like her grandchildren to receive a university education.  She is looking for a loan to purchase livestock and feed.  According to her business plan, this investment will increase her income by 15%.  Arevhat’s capital investment in the farm is around six times more than her outstanding debt.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance and the services provided in Pokr Mantash.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Akal

texts.en:
Akal is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. All of them are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Akal is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 31-year-old married man. He has 6 children aged from 7 to 12 years. He describes himself as a visionary man. He operates a retail store where he sells fruit. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located at a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge as shortages of fruit. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more fruit. His business goal is to own a permanent retail store within 5 years. Peter hopes, in the future, to venture into wholesale trading.

loans.use: To buy more fruit.

loans.name: Hounlessodji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUNLESSODJI est composé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sèdé Germaine  est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Sèdè Germaine est âgée de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Sèdè Germaine est mariée a un chauffeur du nom de Vincent. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à leur charge. Sèdè Germaine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Sèdè Germaine vend par la méthode de distribution depuis neuf ans des plastiques, du lait et divers produits. Sèdè Germaine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sèdè Germaine ensemble avec les membres du  groupe HOUNLESSODJI, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des plastiques, du lait et divers produits.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
John Rey is 18 years old and is youngest of three children in the family. His mother Josephine supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.


John Rey is studying Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and he is currently in the 1st of this 3-year course.

Josephine is borrowing Php 21,000 to pay for tuition fees of the Second Semester of his son for the school year 2015-16.

When he graduates, John Rey plans to graduate and be gainfully employed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
My name is Gregorio V.. I buy and sell meat burritos. I have had my business for 2 years and it has given me the opportunity to escape from unemployment and support my family. My goal is to buy more products to increase my sales and with the profit I will keep on supporting my family, with the priority to provide a good education for my children.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Gregorio V. me dedico a la compra y venta de burritas de carne, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, dicha actividad me a dado la oportunidad de no estar desempleado y he podido mantener a mi familia con las utilidades que obtengo, mi meta es comprar mas producto para tener mayores ventas, y con las ganancias que obtenga mantener a mi familia y lo mas importante es darles un buen estudio a mis tres hijos.

loans.use: To buy meat burritos.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Food production is key to the development of Ghana's economy. Lydia is involved in food production on a commercial basis in her community. She won the "District Best Farmer" in coco yam production. She has been trained in the TEACH Lending skills programme of Kraban Support Foundation and is now able to keep records of her business venture.

loans.use: Farm Implements

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Mrs. Tang C. is 51 years old and lives with her two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Unfortunately, her husband passed away, making the family's financial situation quite difficult.  C. rents rooms from her house to nearby factory workers and can generate about $4 per day.  To help support the family, C.'s children work in a garment factory.  The family hopes to use this loan to build more rooms in their house to rent.  Eventually, C. would like to build another house to rent out to factory workers.

loans.use: To build another room in her house to rent to factory workers

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.en:
Juan M., 36, is married with a daughter, aged 2, and a son, aged 10. He started his copetin, a snack bar, three years ago. He and his wife work at their shop from Monday to Saturday starting at 6 am until 6 pm. His brother also helps him at the store.

Their copetin is located on a busy road in Carapegua. Most of their customers are employees from nearby shops and bus drivers. The copetin sells empanadas, drinks, sandwiches, and food that can be prepared quickly. Before starting their copetin, Juan worked as a shoemaker.

He has been able to expand his business thanks to previous loans and now he is seeking a loan to increase his capital even more, but specifically to purchase more beer and other drinks to keep his business running.

loans.use: Purchase beer and other drinks.

loans.name: Mol

texts.en:
Mrs. Mol T. is 45 years old and lives with her 52-year-old husband and 5 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. They are both farmers, and earn $1 per day. Two of her children are construction workers, two work in a garment factory, and the last is a student.

The two construction workers earn $100 between them. She has applied for this loan for the two construction workers, who need new tools for their jobs.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools for two of her children

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir K. lives in Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 55 years old, is married and has five children.

Mahir is engaged in cattle-breeding. He has 15 years experience at this business. He needs $900 to buy one cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat has been buying and selling household goods for over 5 years. She is married and has 3 children, and her business provides the only steady income for the family. Also, her brother helps her in her business.

From the beginning, she bought goods from suppliers and sold retail. A loan from Microinvest gave her the opportunity to purchase lots of goods, and make a good profit. She requests an additional loan through Kiva so she can purchase a variety of copper containers, such as teapots, watering cans, and containers of different sizes, to sell.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of copper goods to sell

loans.name: Uyi

texts.en: Mrs. Uyi O. is 51 years old. She is married with eight children and lives in Benin City, where she sells women's wrappers and jewelry. She solicits a loan of $700 to buy more wrappers and jewelry for sale. She learned the business for four years, after which she started hers, in 1983. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more women's wrappers and jewelry for sale

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Mrs. Khiev S., 46, is a widow and owns a small booth, selling a variety of fruits, biscuits and some other provisions of food in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Everyday she has to go the market to sell the fruits to the customers, normally earning around $5 a day of profit. She has three children. One son works in Ming Houy Company, earning a salary of $200 a month, and the other one is a motor mechanic, earning around $100 a month. Mrs. Khiev S. hopes to use this loan to purchase another stand in Phnom Penh for her younger daughter to operate, and with rest of the money she will purchase a motorbike to transfer her fruits to market and home. Moreover, this motorbike will br used as a taxi to transfer people in the daytime, to generate more income. She plans to raise pigs at her house, too.

loans.use: To purchase another stand in Phnom Penh for her younger daughter to operate.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.es:
Carmen, Paulina and Sonia are requesting loans of 600,400 and 1000 soles respectively. They want to invest the funds in buying cocoa, sugar, wheat, potatoes, cheese and other items. They are part of the Community Bank “Llapanchik” - which means “Everyone” in the indigenous language of Quechua – for 5, 3, and 5 years respectively.

Carmen is a 34 year old single mother of 3. Carmen and her sons make chocolates ( using cocoa, sugar, cinnamon and cove). It is a family recipe. They sell their chocolate to stores in the city of Ayacucho. Carmen also works in a factory sorting Chinese beans. Paulina is 42 years old, single mother of 3 children. She travels twice a week to buy cereals, small animals and cheese to sell in Puente Nuevo.

Sonia is 29 years old, mother of 3. She travels and buys potatoes, cereals and small animals to resell at the Mery Garcia market. They plan to use their saving to school their children and for emergency funds. They dream to grow their businesses, build their homes and help their children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen, Paulina y Sonia pertenecen al Banco Comunal “Llapanchik” que significa “Todos” en quechua hace 5, 3, 5 años respectivamente.

Carmen es madre soltera, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Carmen junto a sus hijos elabora chocolates ayacuchanos (elaborado con cacao, azúcar, maní, ajonjolí, canela y clavo), actividad que aprendió de familiares, sus productos los vende al por mayor en tiendas y mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Carmen trabaja en un empresa seleccionando arveja china.

Por otro lado Paulina es madre soltera, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Paulina viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana donde compra cereales, animales menores, quesos y los vende en el puente nuevo.

Mientras que Sonia es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Sonia viaja a las ferias donde compra papa, cereales, animales menores, productos que vende en el mercado Nery garcía.

Carmen, Paulina y Sonia necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cacao, azúcar, cebada, arveja, papa, haba y queso.

Sus ahorros lo utilizarán para alguna emergencia y para la educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Carmen, Paulina y Sonia son mejorar más su negocio, sacar adelante a sus hijos, construir su casa.

loans.use: Carmen, Paulina and Sonia are requesting loans of 600,400 and 1000 soles respectively. They want to invest the funds in buying cocoa, sugar, wheat, potatoes, cheese and other items.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana E. is a married woman. She is 25 years old. She sells provisions, drinks and cosmetics, and she has been in this business for the past 5 years. She hails from Igbede, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Christiana needs a loan of $600 to enable her buy more provisions, cosmetics and drinks to sell. With this loan, she said her business will be positioned for greater performance. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sutinah

texts.id:
Sutinah, who originates from Jawa, has been living in Bali since 1998. Her daily work is selling iced young coconut drinks and chicken soup. Everyday she purchase young coconuts from Badung market then repackaged in glass to be sold. Earnings from this are sufficient to set aside for payment of rent for the land amounting to Rp. 4.000.000 (about USD430) per year. Her husband’s earnings as a farmer are insufficient to cover the family’s expenses. Because of that she assist by supplementing the family’s burden. Sutinah hopes the funding will help her business to flourish.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Sutinah, yang aslinya berasal dari Jawa, sudah tinggal di Bali sejak tahun 1998. Pekerjaannya sehari-hari adalah sebagai penjual es kelapa muda dan soto ayam. Setiap hari dia membeli kelapa muda dari Pasar Badung lalu kemudian dijual lagi dalam kemasan gelas. Keuntungan yang didapat cukup untuk disisihkan untuk membayar sewa kontrak tanah senilai Rp.4.000.000.- per tahun. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai petani tidak cukup untuk bisa memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Oleh karena itu dia juga ikut membantu meringankan beban keluarga. Sutinah sangat mengharapkan bantuan modal untuk usahanya sehingga nantinya bisa berkembang lagi.

loans.use: Additional Funding for Business (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Sakhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakhorn O., 50, and her husband, Mr. Heng Leng, 56, live in a small village across from the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1978 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. Four of their children have full time employment and the other four are in school.

Mrs. Sakhorn has been in the business of selling silk products and mosquito nets for three years. She buys them from weavers in her village to then sell in a nearby province. Mr. Heng has been a carpenter for thirty years. The couple hopes to continue to increase their business so that they can support their children’s studies to the highest possible level. She is requesting her first loan, in the amount of US$300, to purchase silk products and mosquito nets for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk products and mosquito nets for resale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Mrs Elvira is 38 years old, married, and has five chidren, four boys and a girl. She lives in the town of Mulla Contihueco, Juli district, Chucuito-Juli province, Puno region and has completed six years of primary education.

For the last ten years, she has been involved in fabric embroidery, having learned the craft from her older brother and the women’s organization in her town. In addition, she is involved in raising cattle and animal husbandry. She speaks both Castillan (European Spanish – Translator) and Aymara (native language of indigenous Aymara people of Peru and Bolivia – Translator)

Elvira decided to become a member of the Las Kantuta de Willkauta Community Bank in order to expand her embroidery business, which she felt was more profitable than animal husbandry. With an initial small loan, she purchased 30 metres of woollen cloth for her business. With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to purchase 40 metres of the same material.

Elvira is very happy that her business has grown and her income has increased, thus enabling her to feed her children. Her greatest desires are to build a home for her family, be successful in her embroidery business, and to educate her children in such a way that they can achieve a measure of success in life.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elvira tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto de primaria, es madre de 5 hijos (4 varones y 1 mujer), habla aymara y castellano, está casada y viven en el Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco del Distrito Juli, Provincia Chucuito-Juli y en la región Puno. Ella se dedica a la actividad económica de Bordado de Bayeta, hace 10 años atrás, gracias a que le enseñó su hermano mayor y en la organización de mujeres del Centro Poblado. Además como actividad complementaria realiza crianza de animales y chacra. La señora Elvira decidió pertenecer al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta, por incrementar la producción, ya que en ese entonces había mayor ganancia en los bordados, así accedió al primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, con ello adquirió 30 metros de bayeta de oveja. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará 40 metros de Bayeta de oveja. Este préstamo será cancelado en un plazo de cuatro meses. Ella está muy contenta ya que incrementó su producción y mejoró sus ingresos económicos, así logra cubrir los gastos de alimentación de sus hijos. Su sueño más grande es construir su casa, ser intermediaria y hacer estudiar a sus hijos de alguna manera para que sean algo en la vida.

loans.use: Purchase of woollen cloth in bulk

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en: Dragana is a married woman living in the village of Kotorsko, outside of Doboj.  Her husband works full-time, and Dragana does some small-scale farming.  She is requesting this first loan from Zene za Zene in the amount of 1500 KM.  With this money she will buy some more pigs and feed for these pigs.  She wants to fatten them, and then sell them for a profit once they are fully grown.  Dragana has some pigs now but wants to take this business up a notch.  With her husband working, she wants to have a real steady job of her own, and needs to invest in her business in order to get there.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah Q. is 42 years old. She is a wife and the mother of seven children. She is a retailer of charcoal and firewood in her local community. Charcoal and firewood are a very popular source of energy for cooking in most traditional Ghanaian homes.

Hannah buys her supply of charcoal and firewood from the villages and retails them to her customers. She has supported five of her children to finish school with income from her business. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal and firewood to serve her customers. She hopes the loan will enable her to save more to support the other two to finish school. She would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Thi Be

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Bé 41 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006. Sinh sống tại vùng nông thôn nên gia đình chị đã lựa chon chăn nuôi và chồng trọt để phát triển kinh tế. Các vòng vốn vay của Qũy gia đình chị đều đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn và trồng cây ăn quả, hàng năm thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và trồng cây ăn quả của gia đình chị ước tính khoảng 60.000.000đ. Chồng chị chuyên đi làm gạch thuê thu nhập hàng tháng 1.500.000đ, chị có 2 con, 1 con nhỏ đang đi học, 1 con lớn đã đi làm lương tháng 1.200.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua giống cây và phân bón.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Be, 41 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. Living in the rural area so her family chose raising livestock and planting to improve the financial situation. All the loans obtained from the Fund are used to invest in livestock and fruit trees, which yield a yearly profit of approximately 60,000,000VND (about 3750USD). Her husband is a hired brick-maker with the monthly income of 1,500,000VND (about 93USD). She has 3 chilren. 2 of them are still going to school while one of them is already working with the mothly income of 1,200,000VND (about 75USD). This time, she would like to borrow 10,000,000VND (625USD) to buy saplings and fertilisers. Her family's average mothly income is 6,000,000VND (about 375USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying saplings and fertilisers

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid tiene 25 años, en la actualidad vive con su pequeño hijo de 4 años. Trabaja en la agricultura, como herencia que le dejaron sus padres, cultiva papa que después vende, su madre es su gran apoyo en todo lo que realiza y está para apoyarle siempre, es por ello que se aboca a las tareas del campo, en la época de siembra y también de cosecha para lo cual su madre está siempre presente para su ayuda. Mientras espera que la cosecha se de tiene un negocio adicional, que es la venta de ropa usada en la ciudad de Tacna, regresa periódicamente para velar por sus cultivos. Para Ingrid  esta actividad es la más factible, ya que al ser independiente, puede atender a su pequeño hijo, aunque a veces el viaje largo es muy pesado. Esta abnegada madre, solicita este préstamo con el invertirá en la siembra, es decir, para la preparación de la tierra con sacos de abono, arado y limpieza de la mala hierba.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 25 years old. Nowadays she lives with her small 4 year old son. She works in agriculture, as passed on to her by her parents. She grows potatoes and then sells them. Her mother is a big support in all that she does and is always there to help her. It's because of this that she is able to work in the fields. During planting season and also during harvesting her mother is always there to help. While she waits for the harvest, she has another business, which is selling used clothing in the city of Tacna. She returns periodically to watch over her crops. For Ingrid, this activity is the most feasible, since being independent enables her to care for her small son, although at times the long trip is very hard. This selfless mother requests this loan. With it she will invest in her crops, that is to say, to prepare the land with sacks of fertilizer, to plow and clear out weeds.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to prepare her land for planting

loans.name: Salustia

texts.en:
Salustia is a member of the Gratitud Village Bank. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Salustia is a teacher at a school near the Muyurina Valley, about 20 minutes outside of the city of Ayacucho in central Peru. She also sells Omnilife natural medicines and cosmetics from a catalog. She sells both products to her friends, family members, and colleagues.  

Salustia needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy natural remedies. Salustia’s dreams are to expand her businesses, to help her children get ahead, and to save for the future. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Salustia es socia del Banco Comunal Gratitud.
Salustia es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Salustia vende medicina natural por catálogos llamado Omnilife, también vende cosméticos por catálogos, ambos productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares y colegas. Además Salustia es docente en un colegio ubicado en la comunidad de Muyurina.
Salustia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicinas naturales.
Los sueños de Salustia son ampliar sus negocios, sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Buy Omnilife natural remedies

loans.name: Phung Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phùng Thị Liên năm nay 37 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con còn nhỏ. Năm 2006 chị Liên tham  gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi 200 con vịt, gia đình chị còn kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá nên thu nhập của gia đình chị Liên rất ổn định (3.000.000đ/ tháng).
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vào kinh doanh và mua thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Phùng Thị Liên is 37 years old. She has 3 young children. She started participating in TYM fund in 2006. Her loans were used to raise ducks. Today she and her family have 200 ducks, they also run a grocery store so they have a good & stable income, 3.000.000 VND a month. This loan cycle, she is requesting 9.000.000 VND to buy more merchandise for her store and food for her ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia L. is 45 years old and a village store owner in Yeban Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. They live in a flood prone area in a former private hacienda. She is married to Mauricio and has four children: Virgilio– 23 years old, an elementary graduate; Belinda– 20 years old, a high school graduate; Estelita– 19 years old, also a high school graduate and working as a domestic helper; and Marvin– 15 years old, a high school undergraduate. Due to the lack of financial resources, they were not able to provide their children with higher levels of education and because some of her children lack the interest to study. 

For 15 years, Leticia was able to maintain her village store through the help of her husband and the financial support of a microfinance institution. She hopes to engage in another type of business in the future and to be able to support her husband in his farming needs since they no longer have children to send to school. She knows that she must work hard in order to achieve her business plan someday and to avoid asking for credit from traders that offer large interests. With this, Leticia would like to borrow a loan of PHP 7,000 that she will invest for her store and farming needs.

loans.use: To maintain and further develop her store

loans.name: Oyeleni

texts.en: Oyeleni A. is a 35-year-old married man with four children.  To earn a living, he mills and sells bags of rice, and he notes that he has been in this line of business for many years.  He is now requesting a loan in the amount of $675 (100,000 NGN) in order to purchase more bags of rice to mill and resell. He thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional bags of rice

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Silvia es casada, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Silvia tiene un kiosco ubicado al frente D. un grifo en donD. venD. bebidas variadas, panes, golosinas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual D. sus hijos.
Silvia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas.
Los sueños D. Silvia son terminar D. construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Firmeza community bank. She is married, 48 years old and has two children. She has a kiosk across from a filling station where she sells drinks, breads, snacks, etc., a business that she operates every day with some help from her children. Silvia needs a 1200-soles loan, money that she will use to buy cold drinks to resell. Silvia's greatest wishes are to finish building her house and to see her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Daria Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Olinda es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Olinda vende cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito, además Olinda es jefa de zona de la empresa Oriflame, tiene a su cargo a varias vendedoras.
Olinda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos variados.
Los sueños de Olinda son ampliar su negocio y sus hijos estudien en colegios particulares.
texts.en:
Olinda is a member of the Banco Comunal Trigales. Olinda is 26 years old, has 2 children, and lives with their father. Olinda sells cosmetics by catalog. She sells to friends and family. Her sales are on credit. Olinda also works for the Oriflame business. She is a region manager and is in charge of several sales women. Olinda needs a loan of 1000 PEN to buy various cosmetics. Olinda’s dreams are to expand her business and have her children study in private schools.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various cosmetics.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna R., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Poin, 43, who live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, were married in 1985 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, one daughter is a garment factory worker and another one attends school. Her husband is blind.

Vanna has been selling porridge and groceries for six years. Vanna’s motorbike broke down so she is asking for her first loan of $250 to make repairs and to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To repair her motorbike and purchase grocery items for resale

loans.name: Oduro

texts.en:
Oduro G. is a forty-five-year-old man. He is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all currently in junior high or primary schools. Oduro says he lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is farming and a trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Oduro runs a drugstore in the community. Oduro sells drugs such as paracetamol, syrups and all other kinds of tablets. His drugstore is located at the local market square. Oduro procures the drugs from big pharmacy shops in nearby towns. He has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure drugs in bulk. He is hopeful to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure drugs

loans.name: Peniel - Group 4

texts.en: The members of this group of five entrepreneurs live in Guaricanos. It is a large neighborhood on the northern limit of Santo Domingo. The brand new Santo Domingo Metro (subway train) has a station right at the entrance of Guaricanos; however, modern improvements haven't reached many of our borrowers' homes. All services, especially water, are scarce. Finding employment is difficult, which is why many people, especially single mothers like Nereida P., find that they need to put their skills to work in order to support their families. Nereida is thirty-six years old and has two children. She didn't complete middle school, but went to beauty school and received a certificate in beauty culture. She set up a salon where she works alone. Peak days are Saturdays and Sundays. She explains that things are not easy lately. "People come less often than before," she points out. Even so, she's been able to build a faithful clientele that will still come to get their hair done at least once a week. Nereida knows they pay not only for the service, they also pay to have HER provide the service. She will use this loan to buy specific hair products so that she can offer "special services" to her customers. When you wash hair with brand name products you can charge more, and Dominican women are willing to pay well to have their hair well taken care of. She will also buy a few new brushes, rollers and pins. This beauty salon is this inspiring young woman's sole source of income. Please help us continue to support her and her work with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy brand name beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Osita

texts.en:
Osita M. is from the town of Luyong Bonbon Opol Mis. Or.. She is 58 years old. Osita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Osita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Osita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Osita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Osita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Osita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to rennovate her residence.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nancy Delfina

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92758&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Nancy es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Nancy se dedica a la venta de tamales, es un negocio familiar, sus padres hacían tamales, sus abuelos también hacían tales es un negocio de generación
Su hijo mayor también participa de la elaboración.. 
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de maíz, hoja de plátano, y todo lo que es necesario.
Desde que Nancy entro a  Finca encontró gran ayuda, financiera por  los prestamos que realizan.
El sueño de Nancy es darle lo mejor a sus hijos y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy's first loan is located here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92758&_tpos=6&_tpg=1 Nancy is a member of the communal bank, "Mujeres Progresando" (Women Progressing). She makes a living by selling tamales, which is a family business. Her parents used to sell tamales, and her grandparents also made them. Her oldest son also helps make them. Nancy needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase corn, banana leaves, and everything that she needs to make her tamales. Since Nancy started working with Finca, she has found them to be a great financial help because of the loans they offer. Nancy's dream is to give the best to her children and to grow in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and banana leaves

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est une dame de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle s’active dans la restauration et aimerait renforcer son capital. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa N. is a 46-year-old woman, married, and the mother of eight. She is active in the restaurant business and would like to boost her capital. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food catering

loans.name: Veronica Zefanias

texts.pt:
Verônica Zefanias M. nasceu no distrito da Manhica (a 72 km a norte da cidade de Maputo) tem 44 anos de idade, mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 são maiores de idade e encontram se a estudarem nas escolas da cidade de Maputo.
Verônica estudou ate 5 classe tendo parado por insuficiência financeiras por parte dos seus pais.

Teve sua infância no distrito da Manhica na companhia dos seus progenitores e quando tinha cerca de 20 anos transferiu se com seu marido para cidade de Maputo, após o casamento.

Conseguiram comprar um terreno e construíram uma casa de material convencional onde vivem juntamente com os filhos e mais dois netos sob sua responsabilidade.
Tem um negocio de venda de refrigerantes, bebidas, recargas para celulares e outros produtos alimentícios a mais de 8 anos de experiência. Aprendeu fazendo e com ajuda do seu marido. Vende mais recargas para celulares e consegue um rendimento diário no valor de 1.500,00MT e poupa cerca de 7.000,00MT mensalmente.

Já teve empréstimos com outras instituições e quando ouviu falar das condições oferecidas pela Hluvuku-Adsema, através das amigas, pagou a divida que tinha e correu para solicitar este primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de diversos refrigerantes e recargas para celulares.

Propõe se a pagar sem problemas para poder aceder a novos empréstimos e cumprir o sonho de melhorar o seu negocio aumentando o volume do mesmo.
texts.en:
Veronica Zefanias M. was born in the district of Manhica (72km north of Maputo), she is 44 years old and is the mother of 4 children, 3 of them are adults and are studying at Maputo's schools. Veronica studied until the 5th grade having to stop because her parents lacked the financial resources to keep her in school. She grew up in Manhica and when she was 20, she moved with her husband to the city of Maputo, after their marriage. They were able to buy land and built a house with regular materials where they live with their children and two grand children who are their responsibility. Their business is to sell snacks, drinks, re-chargeable cards for cell phones and other groceries for the last 8 years. She learned the business with her husband's help. She sells more cell phone cards and obtains a daily income of 1.500,00MT and saves close to 7.000,00MT monthly. Veronica already had credit with other institutions and when she heard about the conditions offered by Hluvuku-Adsema, from some friends, she paid out the balance and run to request her first loan for 20.000,00MT to buy diverse snacks and cards for cell phones. She expects to pay without any problem and be able to get new loans and fulfill her dream to improve her business, by increasing its size.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy snacks and cards for cell phones

loans.name: Joha

texts.en:
Joha is a member of the Muungano C borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 29 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 12 and 3 years.she also cares for other  1 dependent.

Joha started her own business selling cooking oil 2 years ago,she works 2  hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Joha first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more cooking oil for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Joha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah N. is aged 41 years and is a married mother of two children, Newton and Susan. She is married to Duncan Kivida who is aged fifty years. 

Monicah runs a restaurant in Changamwe,Mombasa and she mainly sells roast meat. She has been in the business for 13 years, and her customers have been the residents of Changamwe and business people of the town. This will her first time borrowing from KADET and she plans to purchase more chairs, to repair the hotel floor (in Kenya- hotel is a small restaurant) and to purchase a new meat roasting jiko (stove).

She delights in satisfying her customers and in the future plans to open a similar restaurant in the same or another town to maximize her income.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs, to repair the hotel floor and to purchase a new meat roasting jiko.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne K. is 48 years old and is married with five children aged between 20 and 11. He lives in the Gasabo District of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Etienne owns a small shop where he has sold different kinds of products such as sugar, salt, rice, juice and soap since 2001. He operates his business everyday from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.

Before this loan he is requesting from Vision Finance Company, his business could not give him enough profit and he was not able to afford health care for his children or pay their school fees. With this new loan he hopes to generate extra profits which will help him to change the life of his family. It will also help him to expand the business so that he earns more profits in future.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is a taho vendor in her village. Taho is a snack in the Philippines made of fresh soft/silken tofu with arnibal (brown sugar and vanilla syrup) and pearl sago. She usually carries two large aluminum buckets that hang from each end of a yoke. The bigger bucket carries the tofu base while the smaller one holds the arnibal and sago "pearls". She keeps working hard so that she can continue to send her children to school, since they are only at the elementary level. Jenny is 29 years old and blessed with two children. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. Their income is just enough for their daily needs. With a dream to improve her business, Jenny wants a loan of 6,000 pesos from the Kiva lenders. This money will help make her business productive.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Antonia Gladys

texts.es: La señora Antonia F. tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive en casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos menores. Ella es natural del Caserío de Córdova – Huancavelica, actualmente vive en Caserío San Antonio perteneciente al distrito de Santiago – ICA. Es una persona muy trabajadora que ha comprado su propio terreno y brinda educación a sus hijos tratando de mejorar su forma de vida. Se dedica al negocio de venta de abarrotes en general habiendo implementado una pequeña bodega desde hace 1 año aproximadamente. Además se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos teniendo una pequeña granja en su propio domicilio. Empezó con un capital propio producto de la venta de cerdos. Requiere financiamiento para comprar mercadería y aumentar sus ventas en estos meses de Fiestas Navideñas. Su sueño es construir su casa de material  noble y hacer crecer su negocio para bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonia F. is 44 years old, is a single mother, and lives in her own house with her two youngest children. She is from Caserío de Córdova, Huancavelica. She currently lives in Caserío San Antonio, in the district of Santiago, Ica. She is a very hardworking person who has bought her own land and who is providing an education to her children to improve their lives. She sells groceries and has had a small grocery store for approximately 1 year. She also raises and sells pigs since she has a small farm where she lives. She started her business with her own capital that she got from selling pigs. She needs a loan to buy merchandise and increase her sales during the Christmas holidays. Her dream is to build a house with good materials and to grow her business for the wellbeing of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the Christmas shopping season

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el sector Las Dunas, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 24 años se dedica al comercio de pescado fresco y salado en el mercado central de la ciudad. El nos cuenta que antes trabajaba como estibador en Bayóvar (Piura) y observando la intensa actividad de los comerciantes pesqueros de la zona aprendió lo que necesitaba y empezó a trabajar en este negocio.

El adquiere su mercadería de lunes a viernes en el terminal pesquero de la región (ubicado en el distrito de Santa Rosa), los sábados la compra en el terminal de Piura. El pescado que compra los días sábado lo procesa en el mismo mercado para venderlo como pescado seco – salado los domingos. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso familiar.

Carmen está solicitanto por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería para mantener su negocio durante esta época en que el pescado se pone escaso y sube de precio.

El es un padre honrado y trabajador. Es muy conocido y estimado por sus compañeros de trabajo. Su más grande anhelo es seguir trabajando y comprarse una movilidad propia para poder transportar su mercancía con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 49 year old father who lives with his wife and three children in the Las Dunas district, located in the city of Lambayeque, which is 15 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For 24 years, Carmen has been selling both fresh and salted fish from the central city market. Prior to being a fish vendor, he worked as a longshoreman in Bayóvar (Piura). While at that job, he noticed the intense activity of the local fish traders. He was determined to learn about the business, which led to where he is today.

Carmen acquires his inventory Monday through Friday at the local fishing terminals in the district of Santa Rosa. On Saturday, he buys additional inventory at the terminal in Piura. He then returns to his market stall to process the fish from Piura for drying. The dried fish is salted the following day. Carmen's vending business is the only source of income for his family.

He is requesting his first loan from Edypme Alternativa in the amount of 500 soles. The money will be used to buy more fish because the available supply during this time of the year is lower, so prices are more expensive.

Carmen is an honest and hardworking father. He is well-known and respected among his colleagues. He hopes to continue working as well as purchase a vehicle so that he can transport his goods more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish for processing & selling

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: A. Emilienne est née le 30 Juin 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Emilienne est mariée à ATCHEOU Rodolph et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Emilienne vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint depuis une dizaine d’année à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Emilienne vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Emilienne vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de la sauce aux légumes et du poisson, et du riz). Emilienne  s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Emilienne a déjà acquis 20 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce ; mais elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé. Afin de développer son activité et de l’agrandir davantage, Emilienne sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Emilienne was born on June 30, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to ATCHEOU Rodolph and is the mother of four children who are all in school.  For 12 years, Emilienne has been living with her children and husband in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou.  She comes to her husband's aid to meet family expenses.  Emilienne sells food (cornmeal mash served with a sauce made with vegetables and fish; and rice).  She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She already has 20 years of experience in this business;  but she has never had an ALIDé loan.  To develop her business and to enlarge it still, she's requesting her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and rice

loans.name: Opal Amparo

texts.es:
la sra. Opal Amparo Almendares se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, compra fardos de ropa que viene de estados unidos, este tipo de mercaderia es muy bien vendida en esta zona, siempre la ropa que viene en los fardos es ropa de marca que dura mucho.
sus clientes la prefieren ya que tiene muy buenos precios de venta, a veces las personas no tienen mucho dinero para comprar ropa nueva y optan por comprar ropa de segunda que les sirve igual como si fuera ropa nueva.
esta empezando con su negocio, pero cada dia que pasa esta vendiendo mas y las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes, desea comprar mas fardos de ropa y poder abastecerse de ropa para la epoca de navidad ya que para esos dias las personas compran mucho.
texts.en:
Sra. Opal Amparo Almendares sells used clothing. She buys clothes that come from the United States by the bundle. This type of merchandise sells very well in the area. The clothes always come in bundles and consist of name-brand products that are very durable.
